522.title: Authorizing Division of Highways transfer of spending authority between appropriations
522.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Commissioner of the Division of Highways to utilize the spending authority of the State Road Fund to pay current obligations by moving spending authority within the fund for a fiscal year. This would also give the DOH the same or similar ability to transfer spending authority the other Special Revenue agencies have. When the agency forecasts what funding it will need two years out, the estimates for each appropriation line are never exact. DOH may predict it will need $1 million in maintenance but halfway through the fiscal year the need in maintenance is greater than anticipated. Under this proposed legislation, spending authority could be moved to maintenance from any other appropriation which had been allocated more than will be utilized that fiscal year. The Legislature would still approve the overall allocation for the State Road Fund through the annual budget bill and the Division would report the transfers to the Governor and the Legislature at least annually.

523.title: Relating to when vacancies in the office of magistrate shall be filled by election or appointment
523.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the amendments made to this section by HB 4785 (2022), which changed the timeframe in subsection (d) for filling vacancies in all judicial offices from two to three years.

524.title: Relating to the extension of the expiration of temporary registration plates from sixty days to ninety days
524.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the expiration of temporary registration plates from sixty days to ninety days.

525.title: Requiring cooperation between the rail company and the Division of Highways when construction or maintenance activities are conducted by the company
525.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it clear that rail companies must cooperate with and receive permission from the Commissioner of the Division of Highways before they build or conduct repairs or otherwise preform maintenance on the railroad, tracks or crossings that close state roads. This is to ensure that the traveling public has needed access to emergency services, school, work and is not unnecessarily inconvenienced by road closures.

526.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
526.title: Creating a liaison program with the federal Department of Veterans Affairs Transition Assistance Program
526.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a liaison program with the federal Department of Veterans Affairs Transition Assistance Program in order to actively inform separating and retiring active component service members of the many incentives in relocating to West Virginia upon their conclusion of active service.

527.title: Relating to a permanent windshield placard to be valid for the duration of the applicant’s life
527.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for a permanent windshield placard to be valid for the duration of the applicant's life. This bill is by request of the Department of Transportation.

528.title: Relating to public employees insurance
528.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect solvency of the Public Employees Insurance Agency.

529.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
529.title: Relating to prior authorizations
529.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the law regarding prior authorizations. Provide a new definition regarding an episode of care, require the electronic submission of prior authorizations and related communications; include timeframes to streamline the prior authorization process during the process and the appeal process, provide for oversight and enforcement.

530.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
530.title: Permitting physicians to provide exemption certificates relating to required immunizations
530.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit physicians to provide exemption certificates relating to required immunizations. It removes requirement for certain personnel to report persons not immunized.

531.title: Prohibiting covenant not to compete
531.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of covenants not to compete.

532.title: Requiring usage of child welfare information technology systems
532.description: The purpose of this bill is to develop an online portal to support foster placements and kinship placements with the specific needs for their foster children.

533.title: Relating to Delivery Network Company
533.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Delivery Network Company Insurance Act. The bill sets forth definitions; clarifies the interaction with other code provisions; sets forth insurance requirements; provides for disclosures to delivery network drivers; provides for exclusions in motor vehicle liability insurance policies; and identifies an effective date.

534.title: Travel Insurance Model Act
534.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Travel Insurance Model Act," set requirements for policies, allow rulemaking and enforcement for the Commissioner, setting standards for policies and pricing.

535.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
535.title: Add licensure requirement on substance use disorder inpatient provider facilities
535.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish licensing requirements required for inpatient substance use disorder treatment facilities.

536.title: Make it illegal for any state employee to access Tik Tok through a government device
536.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the No TikTok on Government Devices Act.

537.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
537.title: Develop a licensure process for recovery residences or other residential settings that present as a location where substance use disorder recovery can be facilitated
537.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a licensure procedure for residential Substance Use Disorder service programs. The bill defines terms; establishes licensure application process for substance use disorder service programs; creates program requirements; establishes revocation process; sets forth the reconsideration process; sets forth the administrative due process provision; provides for administrative and judicial appeal; establishes reporting requirements and renewal provisions; sets requirements for continuum of care; and establishes civil penalties and injunctive relief.

538.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
538.title: Make investigation and enforcement of the Patient Brokering Act the responsibility of OHFLAC
538.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the investigation and enforcement of the Patient Brokering Act the primary responsibility of the Office of Health Facility Licensure and Certification ("OHFLAC").

539.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
539.title: Require a study on homelessness be conducted by the Bureau for Behavioral Health
539.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of Health and Human Resources to engage behavioral health and substance use disorder providers, municipal leaders, and county government leaders to study a breakdown of homeless demographic information throughout West Virginia; and report the findings of the study to the President of the Senate, Speaker of the House of Delegates, and the Joint Committee of Finance and Finance.

540.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
540.title: Require Substance Use Disorder inpatient providers to offer patients transportation to certain places upon discharge
540.description: The purpose of this bill is to require substance use disorder inpatient providers to provide transportation to their patients. The bill prohibits certain marketing or partnering with other states. Finally, the bill requires approval for limitation of eligibility.

541.title: Relating to the criminal forfeiture process act
541.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish uniform procedures for civil asset forfeiture.

542.title: Relating to temporary identification cards for released inmates
542.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the temporary identification cards issued upon release to an inmate are at no cost to the inmate and extend the validity of the temporary identification cards to 180 days.

543.title: Permit teachers in K-12 schools be authorized to carry concealed firearms as a designated school protection officer
543.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize teachers in elementary or secondary schools to carry concealed firearms and be designated as a school protection officer.

544.title: Relating to Off Duty LEO and LEOSA Exemptions
544.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the carrying a of a concealed handgun by off duty or retired law-enforcement officers; to authorize off duty or retired law-enforcement officers to conceal carry on and in the State Capitol Complex; and to define terms.

545.title: Creating the Homeschool Credential Recognition Act
545.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the same postsecondary and educational opportunities to homeschool high school graduates as those in public, private, or parochial schools.

546.title: Relating to requiring disclosure of the lawful activity that is the basis of a permit application with the Department of Environmental Protection
546.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the purpose of any activity permitted by the Department of Environmental Protection to allow public disclosure of activities at a permitted location.

547.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
547.title: Expand the scope of hunting, fishing, and trapping benefits provided to former members of the United States Armed forces
547.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a 75 percent discount for a lifetime hunting, fishing, and trapping license or permit for individuals who were honorably discharged from the United States armed forces.

548.title: Allowing a person to manufacture a stated amount of alcoholic liquor for personal consumption
548.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the manufacture in a limited amount of alcoholic liquor for personal use only and not for sale.

549.title: Relating to death penalty for first degree murder
549.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree. Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

550.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
550.title: Eliminating fees for hunting and fishing licenses for military retirees.
550.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the fees for hunting and fishing licenses for military retirees.

552.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
552.title: Permitting religious exemptions for compulsory immunizations
552.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a religious exemption to compulsory school immunizations.

553.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
553.title: Prohibiting mask mandates by the State of West Virginia
553.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit a mask or face covering requirement by the State of West Virginia or by local boards of health in West Virginia.

554.title: To require cameras in every classroom and room where children are present
554.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all schools maintain cameras in areas where students are present in schools.

555.title: Clarifying the announcement form and eligibility requirements for becoming a candidate for election to a public office
555.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the announcement form and eligibility requirements for becoming a candidate for election to a public office; and to establish a deadline and the procedure by and through which an eligibility challenge to a candidate's qualifications to seek and hold the elected office sought may be brought.

556.title: Provide for a special drivers license for those with physical disabilities
556.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the commissioner of Motor Vehicles to design a driver's license with a specific medical condition designation to notify law-enforcement the operator has a medical condition affecting speech, mobility, or other motor functions.

557.title: Provide that someone guilty of a crime where victim was a police officer in performance of duties is ineligible for parole
557.description: The purpose of this bill is to make ineligible for parole someone guilty of a crime in which the victim was a police officer in the performance of that officer's duties.

558.title: Repeal of administrative hearing procedures for DUI offenses
558.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal obsolete code sections relating to a former DUI license revocation process.

559.title: Relating to registration plates
559.description: The purpose of this bill relates to registration plates generally. The bill authorizes special registration plates; establishes fees; and reorganizes the operative code provision for ease of administration.

560.title: Increasing the Homestead Property Tax Exemption
560.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the Homestead Property Tax Exemption from $20,000 to $40,000.

561.title: Relating to felony trespassing
561.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalty of unlawful trespass into the home of another from a misdemeanor offense to a felony offense.

562.title: Raising retirement rate for Deputy Sheriff’s Retirement System
562.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the retirement rate for deputy sheriffs.

563.title: Establishing the Motorsport Responsibility Act
563.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Motorsport Responsibility Act; provide legislative findings; define terms; set forth duties of motorsport operators; set forth duties of motorsport participants; set forth the liability of motorsport operators; set forth the liability of motorsport participants; and provide rule-making authority.

564.title: Requiring certain non-discretionary procedures be strictly complied with by the West Virginia Parkways Authority before tolls, rents, fees or charges may be increased
564.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain non-discretionary procedures be strictly complied with by the West Virginia Parkways Authority before tolls, rents, fees or charges may be increased.

565.title: Require county school boards to have members elected per district
565.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for some county school board members to be elected as at large members and others to be elected on the basis of their magisterial district of residence.

566.title: To create the Protection of Shared Physical and Digital Property from Warrantless Searches Act
566.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Protection of Shared Physical and Digital Property from Warrantless Searches Act. The bill provides for legislative findings. The bill provides for definitions. The bill creates conditions for government to search or seize physical or digital property from a third party. The bill defines illegal searches and seizures. Finally, the bill provides for an effective date.

567.title: To create the Criminal Forfeiture Act
567.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Criminal Forfeiture Process Act, replacing the West Virginia Contraband Forfeiture Act.

568.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
568.title: Relating to warrantless entry of private lands
568.description: The purpose of this bill is to set forth limitations of entry onto private lands; clarify the process for law enforcement entry onto posted private lands; and clarify the use of surveillance cameras on or near posted private lands.

569.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
569.title: To expand recreational benefits to West Virginia Landowners to promote land ownership within the State, increase property value, bolster the State economy, and to provide additional benefits to West Virginia taxpayers
569.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand recreational benefits to West Virginia landowners.

570.title: Municipalities may not assess a user fee when employee was not present in the municipality in the performance of his or her job
570.description: The purpose of this bill is to make unlawful the practice of municipalities' assessing user fees when employees are not present in the municipality in the performance of his or her job.

571.title: Revoke spending authority for money used by an agency in support of a challenge to WV law
571.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit spending authority for money used by an agency in support of a challenge to WV law.

572.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
572.title: To create the Rural Area Department Volunteer Incentive Act of 2023
572.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Fire Commission to reconsider current rules for rural area fire department volunteer firefighters and volunteer firefighters and to propose new rules with the objective of eliminating unnecessarily burdensome or restrictive training and certification requirements.

573.title: Relating to the nonpartisan election of county superintendents of schools
573.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the law relating to the nonpartisan election of county superintendents of schools. The bill provides general provisions for such an election. The bill specifies the arrangement of the ballot to include such officers. The bill provides for the placement of such persons on a primary election ballot. The bill prescribes the manner of election of such persons. The bill provides for the form and content of ballots. The bill provides for the order of offices and candidates on ballots. The bill specifies the term of office for county superintendents of schools. The bill clarifies and enumerates relevant points concerning the election of county superintendents of schools. The bill provides for the filling of vacancies in such office by temporary appointment. Finally, the bill provides for elections to fill such vacancies.

574.title: Requiring an annual test for students to advance to the next grade level
574.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that all K-12 students must exhibit satisfactory academic progress on the comprehensive statewide student assessment before they can advance to the next grade level.

575.title: Relating to a permanent partial repeal of the gasoline tax in WV not to exceed 50% of the current tax
575.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the West Virginia tax on gasoline by 50%.

576.title: To reduce the amount of money provided in welfare programs for certain individuals
576.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the amount of money provided in welfare programs for individuals who can otherwise work or obtain an education.

577.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
577.title: Veterans' Welcome Home Grant
577.description: The purpose of this bill is to assist military service members and honorably discharged veterans with relocation costs; to establish eligibility for grants; to establish how grant amount be determined; and to provide rulemaking authority.

578.title: Allow homestead exemptions for disabled veterans
578.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an Homestead Property Tax Exemption to veterans who are 100 percent disabled and have been determined by the United States Department of Veterans Affairs or its successor to have a 100 percent service connected disability.

579.title: Authorizing a special election for presenting the question of a special levy renewal for levies expiring prior to the primary election scheduled for May 14, 2024
579.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a special election for presenting the question of a special levy renewal for levies expiring prior to the primary election scheduled for May 14, 2024. The bill also authorizes the resubmission of questions to the voters at a regularly scheduled primary or general election for certain levy questions rejected at a prior election.

580.title: Relating to establishing a thirty thousand dollar homestead exemption for taxpayers with a household income at or below U.S. Department of Health & Human Services Poverty Guidelines.
580.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a $30,000 poverty homestead exemption to an owner of a residence whose annual household income is at or below the latest federal poverty guidelines.

581.title: To reflect that County Sheriffs will be required to include a breakdown of the distribution of where a citizen’s taxes will be paid
581.description: The purpose of this bill is to state what information a receipt for taxes from a sheriff shall contain; and how the information may be provided to the taxpayer.

582.title: Relating to indexing unemployment benefits based on the state average unemployment rate
582.description: The purpose of this bill is to create additional eligibility verification for benefits, reduce the maximum duration of benefits period, and implement a system to link the duration of benefits to state economic performance.

583.title: Requiring work search activities to qualify for unemployment benefits
583.description: Requiring work search activities to qualify for unemployment benefits

584.title: To remove the helmet law in West Virginia.
584.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the helmet requirement from motorcycle safety equipment.

585.title: To ensure party affiliation is consistent with candidate’s voter registration
585.description: The purpose of this bill is to require immediate verification of partisan election candidates' party affiliation.

586.title: To provide safe harbor peer review for nurses
586.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a nurse staffing and safe harbor peer review process. The bill defines safe harbor. The bill creates protections for nurse licensure under safe harbor. The bill provides for invocation of safe harbor protections. The bill establishes a withdrawal of request for safe harbor nursing review. The bill provides for when to invoke safe harbor and refuse nursing assignments. The bill establishes a Safe Harbor Peer Review committee and designates the makeup of that committee. The bill defines protection from civil or criminal liability under safe harbor. Finally, the bill defines the duties of CNOs/Nurse Administrators.

587.title: Creating the WV Energy Efficiency Jobs Creation Act
587.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the Public Service Commission the authority to require electric utilities to develop and implement plans for the efficient use, conservation and reduction of electricity usage. The bill sets forth goals to achieve electricity savings. The bill also requires electric utilities to submit plans for reaching those goals. The bill also provides for a self-direct option for large electricity customers.

588.title: Relating to the death penalty for first degree murder
588.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree. Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

589.title: To require that Public Service District Boards that represent more than one community to have at least one member from each community on the board.
589.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that if a public service board represents more than one community, there shall be one member from each such community on the service district board.

590.title: To modify when a nonresident student’s transfer may be denied
590.description: The purpose of this bill is to deny transfers to other schools by students who are suspended or expelled from a school for certain conduct.

591.title: Amending performance evaluations of professional personnel
591.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that employee evaluations must provide data and an explanation in support of any statement or rating in which the employee is assessed to be less than satisfactory.

592.title: Raising salaries for school service personnel
592.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $900 monthly increase to state school service personnel.

593.title: Creating the utility pole rights of way and easement mapping initiative
593.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the utility pole rights-of-way and easement mapping initiative; to require pole owners to provide information to the Department of Economic Development to map the poles; required the Department of Economic Development to create maps with specific information about the poles; to mandate confidentiality of information about electrical facilities connected to poles; to allow the Department of Economic Development to provide information to parties who demonstrate the need for the information to determine feasibility of projects; to mandate confidentiality agreement of any requestor of reported information; and to provide exception to reporting if pole owner provides information directly to telecommunications entity.

594.title: Making disbursement of hotel occupancy tax wholly discretionary
594.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the allocation of the hotel occupancy tax is subject to the sole discretion of the municipality or county commission.

595.title: To remove the taxation on burials, funerals and cremation
595.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a tax exemption for funeral, cremation, and burial services.

596.title: Reestablishing certain specialized school service personnel classifications
596.description: The purpose of this bill is to add special teaching assistants Aide V and Aide VI to the class titles of service personnel of the state minimum pay scale and class titles that are set forth in Â§18A-4-8a of this code. These classifications were inadvertently omitted from 2002 HB4829 that passed in 2022.

597.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
597.title: Relating to vaccination and mask requirements
597.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide parents the freedom to decide whether to have their children vaccinated, to prohibit vaccine mandates as a condition to admission to schools, and to ensure that prior to vaccination that parents receive information about vaccines, including vaccine risks and how to report vaccine injuries. The bill forbids schools from requiring masks on children. The bill allows students to make their own decisions regarding vaccinations as a condition of entry to colleges and trade schools in West Virginia. The bill forbids colleges and trade schools from requiring masks at their campuses for students. The bill forbids businesses from requiring vaccines or masks as a condition of employment or entry into an establishment. The position of Immunization Officer is eliminated.

598.title: All relating to dental health care service plans
598.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for transparency of the expenditure of dental health care plan premiums, and to require annual reports and rebates to patients if the medical loss ratio exceeds a certain percentage.

599.title: Relating to Good Samaritan law
599.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact a Good Samaritan Law. The bill provides that persons who render assistance to a person in an accident, emergency, or disaster, without remuneration, are not liable for civil damages and also that persons trained in a qualified program of emergency response who render assistance to a person in an accident, emergency, or disaster, without remuneration, are not liable for civil damages.

600.title: Removing and modifying certain requirements for employers relating to wages for construction of public improvements
600.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove and modify certain requirements for employers relating to wages for construction of public improvements.

601.title: Clarify that vehicles with a capacity larger than 10 passengers may be used to transport students provided that no more than 10 passengers may be transported at one time.
601.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the provisions of this section to clarify that vehicles with a capacity larger than 10 passengers may be used to transport students and that no more than 10 passengers may be transported at one time.

602.title: Allow pass-through entities to elect to be taxed at the entity level
602.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish allow pass-through entities to elect to be taxed at the entity level and to provide a refundable tax credit to owners or members of an electing pass-through entity on their individual tax returns.

603.title: To require the Department of Environmental Protection to assume responsibility of cost and permitting of dams that are deemed to be under state control
603.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Department of Environmental Protection to assume all costs necessary for certification by a registered professional engineer and to permit a privately owned dam before the secretary may recover costs for repair or remediation from an owner.

604.title: Relating to choice of law provisions in franchise agreements
604.description: The purpose of this bill is to make choice of law provisions in franchise contracts inoperable as a matter of West Virginia law if the West Virginia franchisee objects.

605.title: To remove certain territorial limitations on a banking institution’s ability to offer messenger services or mobile banking facilities
605.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove certain territorial limitations on a banking institution's ability to offer messenger services or mobile banking facilities, except that the 2,000 foot limit to the proximity of another bank's main or branch office remains.

606.title: Authorizing a medical power of attorney representative to sign a binding arbitration agreement
606.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a medical power of attorney representative to sign a binding arbitration agreement with an extended care facility operated in conjunction with a hospital, an assisted living facility, or a nursing home and their related entities and employees on behalf of an incapacitated person unless the representative's authority is clearly limited.

607.title: Relating to the administration of anesthetics
607.description: Relating to the administration of anesthetics

608.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
608.title: Relating generally to hunting and fishing
608.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit fishing trotlines, droplines, and minnow traps to be lawful if certain conditions are met. The bill permits jug fishing, which is using a free-floating device to deploy a hook and line to take or attempt to take fish.

609.title: The Genealogical Record Integrity Act of 2023
609.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Genealogical Record Integrity Act of 2023 to preserve the long-standing custom and tradition of patronymic surnaming convention of children in accordance with and as recognized in common law case precedent.

610.title: Relating to net metering
610.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the method for determining rebates or discounts to customers regarding net metering of electricity. It also requires the Public Service Commission to require compliance with certain national codes.

611.title: Expire and appropriate funds from the Coronavirus State Fiscal Recovery Fund to the Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Properties Program Fund during fiscal year 2023.
611.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to expire and appropriate funds from the Coronavirus State Fiscal Recovery Fund to the Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Property Program Fund, Fund 3305, Fiscal year 2023.

612.title: Authorize the Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Properties Program Fund to be used to demolish certain flood-damaged structures
612.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Properties Program Fund to be used to demolish flood-damaged structures that do not qualify for federal funding in an amount not to exceed any legislative appropriations, grants, or other funding obtained for that purpose.

613.title: Amending Hope Scholarship eligibility
613.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the definition of eligible recipient for the Hope Scholarship Program.

614.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
614.title: To create a new hunting license stamp for upland game bird
614.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "upland game bird" stamp to be administered by the West Virginia Division of Natural Resources.

615.title: Relating generally to bail bondsman
615.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to formulate testing and continuing education requirements for all applicants and license renewals for professional bondsmen in criminal cases. The bill also provides a definition of "approved securities" and amend the definition of "bondsman".

616.title: Relating to no child in the State of West Virginia should be admitted into the general classroom of a public school in WV unless they can speak basic English and meet the same expectations of non-special education students who are native English speakers
616.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exception to compulsory school attendance for certain children who are non-English speaking; and requiring that these children speak English before being admitted into the general classroom of a public school in this state.

617.title: Relating to withholding tax on income of nonresidents from natural resources royalty payments
617.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lessees of West Virginia real estate who make natural resources royalty payments for in-state property to any nonresident lessor, to withhold West Virginia personal income tax on natural resources royalty payments. The bill provides exceptions, penalties, defines terms and grants rule-making authority.

618.title: To implement trauma-informed practices in schools
618.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to implement trauma-informed practices in grades K-12.

619.title: Emergency Absentee Ballot Preparedness Act
619.description: The purpose of this bill is to require, effective January 1, 2025, that each County Commission shall adopt a policy extending the emergency absentee voting procedures.

620.title: Creating the Katherine Johnson and Dorothy Vaughan Fair Pay Act
620.description: The purpose of this bill is to state an employee's right to inquire about wages under the Katherine Johnson and Dorothy Vaughan Fair Pay Act. It requires an employer to provide wage range to applicants; and provides for civil and criminal penalties for violations.

621.title: Relating to preventing compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including certain sums
621.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay for medical care or treatment.

622.title: Requiring certain boards that seek to increase a fee or seek to impose a new fee to also submit cost saving measures
622.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain boards that seek to increase a fee or seek to impose a new fee to also submit cost saving measures undertaken or proposed to be undertaken.

623.title: Relating to criminal trespass
623.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for increased fines for criminal trespass.

624.title: To allow county councils to change name to county commissions
624.description: The purpose of this bill is permit county councils in West Virginia to rename themselves to county commissions.

625.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
625.title: Authorizing dogs to be in certain licensed establishments
625.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit dogs to enter certain areas of private clubs, brew pubs and micro-distilleries; and authorizing the Bureau of Public Health to promulgate any rules related thereto, necessary to protect public health and safety. is

626.title: Repeal code relating to inspection of vehicles
626.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the article creating mandatory state inspections of motor vehicles.

627.title: Relating to the Campus Self Defense Act
627.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the carrying of a concealed pistol or revolver by a person who holds a current license to carry a concealed deadly weapon; authorizing regulation or restriction on the carrying of concealed pistols or revolvers in certain circumstances or areas of an institution of higher education; eliminating authority of the Higher Education Policy Commission, the Council for Community and Technical College Education and the institutional boards of governors to restrict or regulate the carrying of concealed pistols or revolvers in certain circumstances or areas of an institution of higher education.

628.title: Require compensation for state police officers when required to be on standby so they can be called back to work if necessary
628.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that State Police officers be compensated for their time when they are required to be on standby so that they may be called back to work if necessary.

629.title: Exempting personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax
629.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax.

630.title: To provide that out of school suspensions be considered “excused” absences.
630.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for excused absence from compulsory school attendance due to exclusion, suspension, or expulsion in certain circumstances.

631.title: Creating a State Central Legal Advertising Website
631.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Auditor to establish and maintain a State Central Legal Advertising Website to facilitate required legal advertising.

632.title: Authorizing certain agencies of the Department of Administration to promulgate legislative rules
632.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Purchasing.This section is new; therefore,

633.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2638
633.title: Authorizing the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to parking
633.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Parking.This section is new; therefore,

634.title: Authorizing certain agencies of the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate legislative rules
634.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to standards of performance for new stationary sources.This section is new; therefore,

635.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
635.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to requirements for operating permits
635.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to requirements for operating permits.This section is new; therefore,

636.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
636.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to emission standards for hazardous air pollutants
636.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to emission standards for hazardous air pollutants.This section is new; therefore,

637.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
637.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to control of ozone season nitrogen oxides emissions
637.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to control of ozone season nitrogen oxides emissions.This section is new; therefore,

638.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
638.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to rules for quarrying and reclamation
638.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to rules for quarrying and reclamation.This section is new; therefore,

639.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
639.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the recycling assistance grant program
639.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to recycling assistance grant program.This section is new; therefore,

640.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
640.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Properties Grant Program
640.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Reclamation of Abandoned and Dilapidated Properties Grant Program.This section is new; therefore,

641.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2640
641.title: Authorizing the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to reclamation of solar and wind electricity generating facilities
641.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to reclamation of solar and wind electricity generating facilities.This section is new; therefore,

642.title: Authorizing certain agencies and boards of the DHHR to promulgate a legislative rule
642.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to procedures pertaining to the Dangerousness Assessment Advisory Board.This section is new; therefore,

643.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
643.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to standards for local boards of health
643.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to standards for local boards of health.This section is new; therefore,

644.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
644.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to medical examiner requirements for postmortem inquiries
644.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to medical examiner requirements for postmortem inquiries.This section is new; therefore,

645.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
645.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Services to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Medical Cannabis Program - grower and processors
645.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Services to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Medical Cannabis Program - grower and processors.This section is new; therefore,

646.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
646.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Medical Cannabis Program - dispensaries
646.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Medical Cannabis Program - dispensaries.This section is new; therefore,

647.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
647.title: Authorizing the Health Care Authority to promulgate a legislative rule relating to financial disclosure
647.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Health Care Authority Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to financial disclosure.This section is new; therefore,

648.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
648.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Uniform Bill Database
648.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Uniform Bill Database.This section is new; therefore,

649.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
649.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the development of methodologies to examine needs for substance use disorder treatment facilities within the state
649.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the development methodologies to examine needs for substance use disorder treatment facilities within the state.This section is new; therefore,

650.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
650.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Core Behavioral Health Crisis Services System
650.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Core Behavioral Health Crisis Services System.This section is new; therefore,

651.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
651.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to child care centers licensing
651.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to child care centers licensing.This section is new; therefore,

652.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
652.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to minimum licensing requirements for residential childcare and treatment facilities for children and transitioning adults and vulnerable and transitioning youth group homes and programs in West Virginia
652.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to minimum licensing requirements for residential child care and treatment facilities for children and transitioning adults and vulnerable and transitioning youth group homes and programs in West Virginia.This section is new; therefore,

653.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 2648
653.title: Authorizing the Department of Health and Human Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to family child care facility licensing requirements

743.title: Authorizing the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to miscellaneous permits and licenses

744.last_action: To House Economic Development and Tourism
744.title: Relating to the state allocation of funding to regional councils
744.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the maximum allowable state allocation from the West Virginia Department of Economic Development to eligible regional councils for purposes of obtaining federal matching grants.

745.title: Create the Volunteer Immunity and Charitable Organization Liability Limit Act
745.description: The purpose of this bill is to promote the formation, financial stability, and healthy operation of charitable organizations and to encourage volunteerism by limiting the exposure of organizations and volunteers to civil liability arising from their charitable activities.

746.title: Non-Profit Transparency and Accountability Act
746.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Non-Profit Transparency and Accountability Act, which will require that all nonprofit organizations that receive any part of their total operating funds from public sources, whether state or federal, shall be subject to Freedom of Information Act requests and bear the responsibility to respond to these requests under the same requirements as a public body.

747.title: To modify e-bike laws in West Virginia
747.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the laws on e-bikes in West Virginia to more closely comport to federal law.

748.title: Relating to immunizations performed in a pharmacy
748.description: The purpose of this bill is to update rulemaking concerning pharmacy immunizations.

749.title: Create the Multi-Door Courthouse Act
749.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Alternate Dispute Resolution Act.

750.title: Relating to the controlled substance monitoring database; and adding the reporting of medical marijuana to the database
750.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the reporting of medical marijuana to the controlled substance monitoring database.

751.title: Relating to expanding institutional eligibility for the WV Invests Grant Program
751.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand eligibility for the WV Invests grant program to include a hospital based allied health program.

752.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
752.title: Relating to updating the minimum standards for nursing homes
752.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit nursing home rooms to 2 residents.

753.title: Relating to updating the health care provider tax
753.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the health care provider tax.

754.title: To allow CPR fire fighters to drive ambulances when both attendants are needed to administer patient care
754.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit firefighters to drive ambulances at the scene of an emergency in limited circumstances.

755.title: To allow classroom aides with 10 or more years of service and good evaluations to bid on teaching positions
755.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county boards to employ eligible classroom aides as classroom teachers when certain conditions are met.

756.title: Allowing variance in state fire code for certain buildings used solely for emergency equipment storage
756.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Fire Commission to propose rules providing that buildings commencing construction after July 1, 2023, housing emergency fire, rescue, or ambulance services shall be protected throughout by approved automatic sprinkler systems, and providing an exemption.

757.title: To provide for an updated definition of first degree murder on a law enforcement officer
757.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the definition of murder in the first degree when the intended victim is engaged in the course of performing certain specific types of employment in law enforcement, employees of the correctional systems; employees of first responder services, the members of the state judiciary system, and employees of various social services provided by the state.

758.title: Increase salary of constitutional officers
758.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase compensation for the Attorney General, Auditor, Secretary of State, Commissioner of Agriculture, and State Treasurer all designated as constitutional officers.

759.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
759.title: Authorizing certain ambulance crew members, firefighters, rescue squad members and emergency service personnel to carry firearms
759.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize supervising entities to authorize ambulance crew members, firefighters, rescue squad members and emergency service personnel to carry firearms. It specifies the training required for them to be eligible to carry a firearm and allows them to be reimbursed for the cost of the training.

760.title: To clarify when inmates may receive “good time” or time served
760.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that offenders of certain criminal offenses are not entitled to the deduction from a sentence of incarceration for good conduct. These offenses include an inmate sentenced to a life sentence, certain offenses relating to crimes against the person, sexual offenses, child abuse, or human trafficking. The bill also requires that all persons not eligible for good time have one year of mandatory post-release supervision following the first instance in which the inmate reaches his or her calculated discharge date; and providing that all inmates so released are subject to electronic or GPS monitoring for the entire period of supervision.

761.title: Constitutional Officer Housing allowance
761.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a housing allowance of $2,000 per month for designated state constitutional officers to assist in residing in the seat of state government.

762.title: To require all state entities and Chapter 30 boards to use “.gov” domains and e-mail addresses
762.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state entities and Chapter 30 boards to utilize a ".gov" website domain and e-mail address in order to identify them as an official government entity.

763.title: Remove licensure requirements for certain radon specialists
763.description: The purpose of this bill is remove the licensure requirement for radon mitigation contractors, radon mitigation specialists, and radon testers.

764.title: Expanding the eligibility requirements for private investigator and security guard licensure
764.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the eligibility requirements for private investigator and security guard licensure.

765.title: Removing marijuana as a tested substance from the screening requirements
765.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove marijuana as a tested substance from the screening requirements of the West Virginia Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Act.

766.title: Create the Statewide Online Education Act
766.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a Statewide Online Education Program to enable eligible students to earn high school graduation credit through the completion of publicly funded online courses.

767.title: Create the Education Tax Credit
767.description: The purpose of this bill is to give a tax credit against taxes actually owed, for qualifying expenses of parents or guardians of children in grade levels K through 12.

768.title: Welcome Home Grant Program
768.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Welcome Home Grant Program, a pilot program to incentivize veterans to relocate to West Virginia to reside and to work.

769.title: Raise pay for certain state employees
769.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the salaries of certain state employees including: WV State Police and certain personnel; public school teachers; and school service personnel.

770.title: Updating meaning of federal adjusted gross income and certain other terms used in West Virginia Personal Income Tax Act
770.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of federal adjusted gross income and certain other terms used in the West Virginia Personal Income Tax Act; and specify effective dates.

771.title: Updating federal taxable income and other terms in the West Virginia Corporation Net Income Tax Act
771.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of "federal taxable income" and certain other terms used in the West Virginia Corporation Net Income Tax Act by bringing them into conformity with their meaning for Internal Revenue Code's definitions; and specify effective dates.

772.title: To create curriculum transparency in public schools
772.description: The purpose of this bill is to require schools to publish the adopted, up-to-date classroom curriculum online at the beginning of each school year, or within 30 days of updating or adopting curriculum, to promote transparency in curriculum requirements.

773.title: To make those who fail drug test ineligible for unemployment
773.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a person, who fails a random testing for alcohol or illegal controlled substances for employees in safety-sensitive positions, is disqualified for unemployment compensation benefits.

774.title: Repeal municipal amusement tax
774.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the municipal amusement tax.

775.title: Establishing Comprehensive Highway Paving Plan
775.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to prepare and present to the Legislature a comprehensive highway paving plan establishing routine repaving of all normally asphalt-surfaced roads.

776.title: Require all municipal elections be held on the same election day in November that other state elections are on
776.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that municipal elections be held concurrently with regularly scheduled primary or general elections.

777.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
777.title: To remove primates as a dangerous wild animal
777.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt primates from the Dangerous Wild Animal Review Board's list of animals classified as dangerous wild animals.

778.title: Relating to duty to prosecute
778.description: The purpose of this bill is to state the mandatory duty of prosecuting attorneys to prosecute persons accused of committing criminal acts; duty to create file on cases not prosecuted; and when the county commission, in cooperation with the West Virginia prosecuting attorneys Institute, shall select and appoint a special prosecuting attorney.

779.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
779.title: Relating to PEIA reimbursement
779.description: The purpose of this bill is to reimburse individuals for healthcare costs at a facility who no longer accepts PEIA.

780.title: Objective Reality in Government Act
780.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Objective Reality in Government Act.

781.title: Farm Direct Feed Sales Exemption
781.description: The purpose of this bill is to; provide that persons engaged in selling products or commodities produced exclusively on their own farm are not distributors and are exempt from obtaining a Commercial Feed Distributor Permit West Virginia.

782.title: Repealing vehicle inspection sticker requirements in WV
782.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the article creating mandatory state inspections of motor vehicles.

783.title: Removing birthing centers from certificate of need
783.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt certain services from the certificate of need.

784.title: WV Historical Monument Preservation and Restoration Act
784.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the relocation, removal, alteration, renaming, rededication, or other disturbance of any statue, monument, memorial, nameplate, or plaque which is located on public property and has been erected for, or named, or dedicated in honor of certain historical military, civil rights, and Native American events, figures, and organizations; to prohibit any person from preventing the governmental entity having responsibility for maintaining the items, structures, or areas from taking proper measures to protect, preserve, care for, repair, or restore the items, structures, or areas; and to establish a process by which the West Virginia State Historic Preservation Office may grant waivers under certain circumstances.

785.title: Relating to appointing members to county authorities
785.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the manner of appointing members to county authorities and allowing appointments of members from contiguous counties.

786.title: Relating to Election Runoff
786.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a runoff election in certain nonpartisan elections where no candidate receives more than 50 percent of the votes cast in an election.

787.title: Relating to mental health treatment for inmates
787.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the process for involuntary hospitalization of an inmate.

788.title: To create a special license plate for 100% disabled veterans
788.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special license plate for 100% disabled veterans.

789.title: To update the definition of libel in West Virginia
789.description: The purpose of this bill is to define libel. It provides for liability; exceptions; criminal proceedings; and criminal penalties.

790.title: To exempt daylight fluorescent outer garments from sales
790.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt daylight fluorescent orange outerwear purchases from sales tax.

791.title: Providing that microschool tuition and fees are qualifying expenses for Hope Scholarship accounts
791.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that microschool tuition and fees are qualifying expenses for Hope Scholarship accounts.

792.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
792.title: Clarifying that the time limitations provided for filing occupational pneumoconiosis claims do not apply or otherwise limit the ability of a claimant to obtain an evaluation from the Occupational Pneumoconiosis Board.
792.description: The purpose of this bill is to is to clarify that the time limitations provided for filing occupational pneumoconiosis claims in this section does not apply to or otherwise limit the ability of a claimant to obtain an evaluation from the Occupational Pneumoconiosis Board.

793.title: Impose criminal liability and penalties upon purchasers of goods for delivery who refuse to return rejected goods to the vendor after the purchaser has had their purchase money reimbursed
793.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose criminal liability and penalties upon purchasers of goods for delivery who refuse to return rejected goods to the vendor after the purchaser has had their purchase money reimbursed.

794.title: All relating to authorizing legislative rules regarding higher education
794.description: This purpose of this bill is to authorize legislative rules for the Higher Education Policy Commission regarding Performance-Based Funding Formula, Capital Project Management, Tuition and Fee Policy, Higher Education Grant Program, Annual Reauthorization of Degree-Granting Institutions, and Human Resources Administration; and to authorize legislative rules for the Council for Community and Technical College Education regarding Performance-Based Funding Formula, Capital Project Management, Workforce Development Initiative Grant Programs, Annual Reauthorization of Degree-Granting Institutions, and Human Resources Administration.

795.title: Relating to Social Media privacy and educational institutions
795.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish social media privacy for current and prospective students or employees of higher education institutions operating in the state of West Virginia for content not publicly available on the internet.

796.title: Creating the Economic Development Tuition Waiver
796.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide tuition fees at an institution of higher education for certain persons, who are not yet residents, at the rate for residents of the state. The bill also provides requirements to be met by these persons before qualified for resident tuition rates, based upon employment by a business or organization that is established in this state as part of a program under the Economic Development Act of 1985.

797.title: Remove felonies from reason to disqualify from voting
797.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the prohibition on persons convicted of certain felonies from voter registration and to allow persons to re-register to vote following completion of their sentence or pardon; requiring the Division of Corrections to notify persons of their renewed eligibility to vote upon release; and requiring the Division of Probation to notify persons of their renewed voter eligibility upon discharge.

798.title: Reinstate the Contractor Licensing Board under the Division of Labor in Chapter 21
798.description: The purpose of this bill is to reinstate the Contractor Licensing Board under the Division of Labor in Chapter 21 as it existed prior to June 15, 2021.

799.title: Amending requirements for licensure relating to elevator mechanics, crane operators, HVAC, electricians, and plumbers
799.description: The purpose of this bill is to The purpose of this bill is to alter requirements for licensure relating to elevator mechanics, crane operators, HVAC, electricians, and plumbers back to what existed in the code before repeal of certain sections.

800.title: Relating to an occupational limited license
800.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for an occupational limited driver's license.

801.title: Creating the Virtual Public Schools Act
801.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Virtual Public Schools Act. The bill provides a short title, legislative findings and declaration of intent, and definitions. The bill also provides accountability requirements.

803.title: Relating to protections for workers at state health care facilities who report unsafe patient care or unsafe patient conditions
803.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide whistleblower protections to employees of state hospitals who report unsafe practices to governmental or regulatory agencies or the federally mandated protection and advocacy system.

804.title: Relating to data disposal protection
804.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the destruction of customer's records that contain personal information no longer needed by the business.

805.title: Permitting anyone over 65 to vote absentee
805.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow voters 65 and older to vote absentee.

806.title: Modifying legislative spending in both chambers
806.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Legislature to conduct all official business at the State Capitol.

807.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
807.title: Provide for disclosure of potentially harmful ingredients in menstrual products
807.description: The purpose of this bill is to require packaging of menstrual products sold in this state to contain a plain and conspicuous printed list of all ingredients listed in order of predominance. The bill also imposes a civil penalty for violations.

808.title: To create a Hydrogen power task force
808.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Hydrogen Power Task Force.

809.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
809.title: Provide that first $5000 per year earned on Military Duty, Active, National Guard, or Reserves be exempt from the WV State Income Tax.
809.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a $5,000 tax credit for all active-duty military personnel, including National Guard active-duty members and reserve members.

810.title: Any judgment by a mayor, any individual exercising the mayor’s functions, the police court judge, or municipal judge of city be obligated to the Model Rules of Judicial Conduct.
810.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language mandating that any judgment by a mayor, any individual exercising the mayor's functions, the police court judge, or municipal judge of city be obligated to the Model Rules of Judicial Conduct.

811.title: Relating to Public Service Commission jurisdiction over alternative fuel for motor vehicles
811.description: The purpose of this bill is clarifying the definitions of alternative fuel and alternative fuel vehicles, limiting Public Service Commission jurisdiction over temporary charging locations with movable generators for technological demonstrations at fairs, festivals, and other special events and at temporary charging locations with movable generators where the electric distribution grid has been adversely effected by emergencies or disasters, natural or otherwise.

812.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
812.title: Make first day of gun season for deer to Saturday before Thanksgiving holiday
812.description: The purpose of this bill is to move the opening date of firearms season for deer to begin on the Saturday before the week of Thanksgiving each year.

813.title: To add State Fire Marshals to the statute to be included with law enforcement that receive information related to school safety requirements
813.description: The purpose of this bill is to include State Fire Marshals in the code section with local law enforcement and first responders that receive information related to school safety requirements. This bill was recommended for passage in the 2023 regular session by the Department of Homeland Security.

814.title: To provide HOPE Scholarship recipients with the ability to play sports
814.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow participants in the Hope Scholarship Program and in Microschools and Learning Pods to access to athletic programs.

816.title: Relating to the consumers sales and service tax and returning the refundable exemption for sales of construction and maintenance materials acquired by a second party for use in Division of Highways projects
816.description: The purpose of this bill is to return to the Division of Highways the sales tax collected from contractors for materials used in Highways construction and maintenance projects. As long as the contractors sales tax is going to the general revenue, DOH is paying sales tax to the state. No other agency of state government pays state sales tax.

817.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
817.title: Allowing for Religious Exemptions of Vaccine Requirements in Primary and Secondary Schools
817.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for religious exemptions of vaccine requirements in primary and secondary schools.

818.title: Relating to campus carry
818.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the carrying of concealed weapons on the campus of a state institution of higher education by individuals who have been issued state licenses to carry concealed deadly weapons pursuant to W. Va. Code, Â§61-7-4.

819.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
819.title: Relating to prohibiting mask mandates
819.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide limitations on mask wearing requirements.

820.title: Remove variable rate on gas tax
820.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the variable gas tax rate.

821.title: Make public charter schools eligible for Safe Schools Funds
821.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend this statute to make public charter schools eligible for Safe Schools Funds; provide that Safe Schools Funds shall be distributed providing that Safe Schools Funds shall be distributed first to meet the special education video requirements, then safe school entry way needs, and when met, on the basis of need; provide that any moneys distributed from the Safe Schools Fund for facility improvements shall only be expended on facilities owned by a county board of education, public charter school or multicounty vocational center, unless the improvements to such facilities may be removed with minimal effort; and, provide that the West Virginia Board of Education shall promulgate rules to govern the process by which county boards of education, public charter schools and multicounty vocational centers may apply for needs-based funding from the Safe Schools Fund.

822.title: Relating to WV teaching salaries
822.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an across-the-board raise for teachers' minimum salaries to bring about parity with teacher salaries in surrounding states.

823.last_action: To House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services
823.title: To increase pay for EMT drivers
823.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a permanent salary increase for emergency medical technicians.

824.title: Providing for solar energy production on formerly mined land
824.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage solar energy development on lands formerly used for mining and certain third-party co-generation projects, to provide electricity for commercial, industrial and manufacturing businesses or institutions of higher education or nonprofit organizations that are located in or will locate operations in West Virginia; authorizing the Public Service Commission to regulate the use of transmission and distribution lines to transport power from these facilities; providing that the solar operations and third-party co-generation projects are not regulated as a utility for providing electricity to these businesses; and authorizing the issuance of renewable energy certificates for renewable energy generated by eligible solar projects.

825.title: Relating to limiting the personal income tax
825.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish that first $20,000 of taxable income not subject to personal income tax but income in excess of that amount be subject to a fixed three percent.

826.title: Clarifying appropriate and inappropriate duties for school counselors while also providing the definition of a school counselor.
826.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify appropriate and inappropriate duties for school counselors while also providing the definition of a school counselor.

828.title: Amending the existing War Orphan program so children and spouses of deceased active-duty officers AND enlisted Service members would both be eligible for the War Orphan Education Program
828.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the children and spouses of deceased active-duty officers in eligibility for tuition-free education through the War Orphan Education Program.

829.title: Repeal outdated provisions of code relating to the West Virginia graduate college and Marshall University
829.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal outdated provisions of code relating to West Virginia Graduate College and Marshall University.

830.title: Relating to contested elections procedure update
830.description: The purpose of this bill is to make procedures for election contests before a special court applicable to contested elections of certain judges; changing jurisdiction of election contests for county, district, and municipal elections to the circuit courts; requiring a recount proceeding to be completed before filing certain election contests.

831.title: Relating to intentionally fleeing or attempting to flee in a vehicle from a law-enforcement officer, probation officer, or parole officer
831.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the criminal penalty for intentionally fleeing or attempting to flee in a vehicle from a law-enforcement officer, probation officer, or parole officer.

832.title: Litterbug Act
832.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Litterbug Act. The bill creates a short title. The bill provides for legislative findings and a purpose. The bill provides for enactment of the article and funding. Finally, the bill provides for a notice requirement.

833.title: Making a technical correction regarding an incorrect fund name and clarifying applicability to mine lands governed by SMCRA and the Abandoned Mine Lands Act
833.description: The purpose of this bill is to make a technical change correcting an incorrect fund name and to clarify the applicability of Â§2-2-10 to mine lands governed by both Â§2-3-1 et seq. and Â§2-2-1 et seq.

834.title: Relating to expenditures of federal appropriations from Congress to the Secretary of State for purposes that further the administration of federal elections held in the state
834.description: The purpose of this bill is to expend federal appropriations from Congress to the Secretary of State for purposes that further the administration of federal elections held in the state, payable from the County Assistance Voting Equipment Fund.

835.title: To create the Occupational Licensing Legal Fund in the State Treasury
835.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a special revenue fund out of existing receipts to pay legal fees and court costs to the West Virginia Attorney General, or other counsel, incurred within the operation of the occupational licensing boards.

836.title: Repeal municipal license and tax when state license required
836.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the provisions authorizing municipalities to require a municipal license when a state license is required for the same activity or purpose and to repeal municipal license taxes.

837.title: Relating to statute of limitations for discrimination
837.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the definition of employer and the number of persons employed to qualify as an employer; and to extend the period of the statute of limitations to file a complaint for an alleged unlawful discriminatory practice under the the Human Rights Commission.

838.title: Relating to anti-discrimination protections for independent contractors
838.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the term 'employee' to include an individual who provides work for an employer under the terms of an independent contract with such employer.

839.title: Relating to removing expired provisions from the code
839.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal an expired pilot program.

840.title: To limit the amount of ballot propositions.
840.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the placing of questions on the primary election ballot submitted by a political party.

841.last_action: To House Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
841.title: To impose a life sentence on fentanyl dealers
841.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose a life sentence on fentanyl dealers.

842.title: Water and Sewer Operator licensing reciprocity
