1477.description: The purpose of this bill approve the creation of the West Virginia First Foundation pursuant to the terms of the West Virginia First Memorandum of Understanding and to authorize the appointment of board members to the West Virginia First Foundation by the Governor and Regional authorities.

1478.title: Relating to SNAP benefits
1478.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the employment and training requirements for individuals to receive SNAP benefits.

1479.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1479.title: Relating to Medicaid Waiver Package
1479.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Medicaid Sustainability Act of 2023. The bill provides for a short title. The bill provides for a purpose. The bill provides for hospital presumptive eligibility. The bill creates a fraud lockout. The bill creates automatic renewal and prepopulated form. The bill provides for biannual and quarterly redeterminations. The bill provides for a mandatory job search. The bill creates work requirements. The bill provides for state plan amendments and waivers. The bill provides for severability. Finally, the bill provides an effective date.

1480.title: Allocating a percentage of county excise taxes received from transfers of title to real estate in each county for election administration improvements
1480.description: The purpose of this bill relates to the real property excise tax. The bill allocates a percentage of county excise taxes received from transfers of title to real estate in each county for funding improvements to election administration, infrastructure, and physical and cyber security; allocates a percentage of county excise taxes received from transfers of title to real estate in each county for funding other county purposes including but not limited to compliance with the Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act; authorizes the Secretary of State to promulgate legislative rules establishing minimum adequate funding thresholds and standards based on county classification for improving election administration, infrastructure, and security; and authorizes county clerks to reallocate the excess portion of funding for improving election administration, infrastructure, and security to other approved county purposes upon determination by the Secretary of State that the minimum funding thresholds and standards have been met.

1481.title: Relating to cost-sharing calculations for certain Health Savings Account-qualified High Deductible Health Plans
1481.description: The purpose of this bill is to update fairness in cost sharing calculations for certain Health Savings Account-qualified High Deductible Health Plans.

1482.title: Moving the state primaries to August
1482.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the time of holding primary elections to the second Tuesday in July 2024, and in each second year thereafter.

1483.title: To make the fire board or county commission responsible for the operations of every fire department within their county
1483.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant administrative control of fire departments within a county to a county fire board or, in the absence of a fire board, to the county commission in that county when they are not already under administrative control of a municipal corporation.

1484.title: Relating to consolidation of local governments
1484.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the State Code regarding the consolidation of local governments; setting forth legislative findings; providing definitions; delineating the powers and privileges of a consolidated local government; providing for additional limitations on the actions of consolidated local government; amending the composition of a metro charter review committee; providing for additional public hearings in the charter review committee process; modifying the percentage vote required to approve metro government in municipal and countywide elections from 55 percent to a majority in counties with populations below 20,000; and removing the time limit for other municipalities to apply to join a metro government.

1485.title: To increase criminal penalty for shooting at or killing a uniformed police officer
1485.description: The purpose of this bill is to classify the intentional murder of a law-enforcement officer or corrections officer with a deadly weapon as felony murder, and to provide for a mandatory life sentence upon conviction.

1486.title: Relating to the distribution of certain taxes and surcharges to benefit volunteer and part-volunteer fire departments
1486.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend and reenact codes concerning the distribution of certain taxes and surcharges to benefit volunteer and part-volunteer fire departments and emergency medical services providers as well as certain funds from the Fire Protection Fund.

1487.title: Relating to prohibiting certain foreign ownership of agricultural land
1487.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain foreign ownership of land in this state.

1489.title: To modify certain election laws, early voting laws, and absentee voting laws
1489.description: The purpose of this bill is to make general modifications to early voting procedures; registration by mail; voter registration services; unlawful registration or rejection of voter; alteration or destruction of records; early in person voting; and criminal penalties.

1490.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1490.title: To create the Responsible Fatherhood Act
1490.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Responsible Fatherhood Act.

1491.title: To prohibit rank choice voting in West Virginia
1491.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit ranked choice voting in West Virginia.

1492.title: Relating to the Consumer Data Protection Act and establishing a framework for controlling and processing personal data in the State
1492.description: The purpose of this bill is to all create the Consumer Data Protection Act. The bill establishes a framework for controlling and processing personal data in the state. The bill creates definitions. The bill limits application to all persons that conduct business in the state and either control or process personal data of at least 100,000 consumers or derive over 50 percent of gross revenue from the sale of personal data and control or process personal data of at least 25,000 consumers. The bill provides for exemptions. The bill delineates responsibilities and privacy protection standards for data controllers and processors. The bill clarifies standards do not apply to state or local governmental entities. The bill provides exceptions for certain types of data and information governed by federal law. The bill provides that consumers have rights to access, correct, delete, obtain a copy of personal data, and to opt out of the processing of personal data for the purposes of targeted advertising. The bill provides that the Attorney General has exclusive authority to enforce violations of the law. The bill provides for assistance of the Attorney General in obtaining relief. The bill establishes the Consumer Privacy Fund to support this effort. Finally, the bill provides for construction and an effective date.

1493.title: To permit joint tenancy with rights of survivorship when transfer on death deeds specify a joint tenancy with right of survivorship
1493.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow death deeds to specify joint tenancy with right of survivorship.

1494.title: Allowing consumer lenders to permit employees to conduct certain business at locations other than the licensee’s designated office
1494.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit regulated consumer lenders to permit employees to conduct certain business at locations other than the licensee's designated office.

1495.title: Creating the Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Instruction Fund
1495.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special revenue fund known as the Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Instruction Fund to provide funding for CPR instruction to high school students.

1496.title: Bifurcating the ethics commission
1496.description: The purpose of this bill is to bifurcate the Ethics Commission, establishing a Legislative Ethics Commission.

1497.title: Relating to nondiscrimination at institutions of higher education
1497.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent discrimination at institutions of higher education at West Virginia post-secondary institutions.

1498.title: Requiring sign up to run as an independent in January of election year
1498.description: The purpose of this bill is to require independent candidates for political office to file for office as an independent in January of an election year.

1499.title: Requiring response by fire departments be based upon distance/travel time from fire scene
1499.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the fire commission establish a system of predetermined alarm assignments to assist fire departments with backup assistance based upon distance to an emergency.

1501.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1501.title: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorders Insurance Coverage Protection Act
1501.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Mental Health and Substance Use Disorders Insurance Coverage Protection Act.

1502.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1502.title: To create the Core State Behavioral Health Crisis Services System
1502.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Core State Behavioral Health Crisis Services System.

1503.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, Public Service Commission – Consumer Advocate Fund
1503.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1504.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Administration, Office of Technology – Chief Technology Officer Administration Fund
1504.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1505.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Education, State Board of Education – School Lunch Program
1505.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1506.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Human Services
1506.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1507.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Homeland Security, Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation – Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority
1507.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, decrease and add new items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1508.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health – West Virginia Birth-to-Three Fund
1508.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1509.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Veterans’ Assistance, Veterans’ Facilities Support Fund
1509.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1510.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health – West Virginia Safe Drinking Water Treatment
1510.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health -- West Virginia Safe Drinking Water Treatment, fund 8824, for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1511.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Human Services – Child Care and Development

1512.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Agriculture
1512.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1513.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Transportation, Division of Motor Vehicles
1513.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1515.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1516.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1517.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, Economic Development Authority
1517.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1518.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Agriculture – West Virginia Spay Neuter Assistance Fund
1518.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1519.title: Relating generally to taxation of solar panels used as energy wholesale generator or small scale utility
1519.description: The purpose of this bill is to tax solar panels used as energy wholesale generators or small scale utilities.

1520.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, Public Service Commission
1520.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1521.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Department of Education, School Building Authority
1521.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1522.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health – Hospital Services Revenue Account Special Fund Capital Improvement, Renovation and Operations
1522.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1523.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Commerce, State Board of Rehabilitation – Division of Rehabilitation Services
1523.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1524.title: Relating to tax reductions and other aid
1524.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide tax reductions and other aid to West Virginians. The bill states a purpose; provides for a child tax credit; provides for a child and dependent care tax credit; authorizes an earned income tax credit; authorizes a student loan interest tax credit; and provides for rulemaking and an effective date.

1525.title: Relating to issuance of restricted license
1525.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a restricted license to licensees suspended under certain provisions and to require the licensee pay a fee for the issuance of a restricted license.

1526.title: Creating a Meat Cutting and Processing Program
1526.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Meat Cutting and Processing Pilot Program for Kanawha County Schools in the Career and Technical Education Centers.

1527.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1527.title: Granting jurisdiction to supervise youth sport league events to county boards of education and the West Virginia Athletic Trainers Association
1527.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant jurisdiction to supervise youth sport league athletic events to county boards of education and the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission and to establish the West Virginia Youth Sports Safety Commission and empower it to create and enforce safety procedures for physical training for youth sports leagues and secondary schools interscholastic activities. The bill requires schools and youth sport leagues to implement certain safety measures during athletic events. The bill authorizes fines and requires rulemaking.

1528.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1528.title: Relating to insurance copayments for certain services
1528.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit an insurer from imposing a copayment for services rendered by a licensed occupational therapist, licensed occupational therapist assistant, licensed speech-language pathologist, licensed speech-language pathologist assistant, licensed physical therapist or a licensed physical therapist assistant that is more than a copayment imposed for the services of a primary care physician or an osteopathic physician.

1529.title: Prohibiting the transportation and incarceration of political prisoners in West Virginia
1529.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the transportation of political prisoners through or above West Virginia and the prohibit the incarceration of these political prisoners within the state.

1530.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1530.title: Relating to annual suicide prevention training and dissemination of resources for school staff
1530.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the code concerning suicide prevention awareness and dissemination of information concerning the same.

1531.title: Relating to granting the Intermediate Court of Appeals jurisdiction to hear certified questions
1531.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a party to a civil action to seek an expeditious answer to a certified question on the constitutionality of any statute, rule, or executive order from the Intermediate Court of Appeals while pending in circuit court.

1532.title: Relating to limitations on the computation, imposition and collection of the business and occupation tax by municipalities
1532.description: The purpose of this bill is to place certain limitations on the computation, imposition and collection of the business and occupation tax.West Virginia Code Â§18-2-25 was amended by two bills passed during the 2020 Regular Session of the Legislature, by the House. House Bill 4636 (passed last on March 12, 2022); House Bill 4567 (passed first on March 11, 2022). The two versions of this section have been merged into this bill.

1533.title: Relating to increasing individual customer on-site generator limits
1533.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase individual customer on-site generator limits of designing a photovoltaic energy facility to meet only the electrical needs of the premises of the retail electric customer so as to not exceed 1,000 kW for commercial customers.

1534.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1534.title: Requiring regular reporting of recommended reimbursement rates for IDD providers
1534.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources to prepare reports to the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House of Delegates and the Legislative Commission on Health and Human Services Accountability that determine recommended levels of reimbursement for home and community based providers that serve patients with intellectual and development disabilities (I/DD).

1535.title: Moving recovery of certain expenses from the reconcilable rate to be charged to the users of the broadband facilities
1535.description: The purpose of this bill is to move the recovery of certain expenses from the reconcilable rate to be charged to the users of the broadband facilities.

1536.title: Expiring funds to the Department of Administration, Board of Risk and Insurance Management, Public Entity Insurance Trust Fund
1536.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to expire funds from the aforesaid account to another account in the fiscal year 2023.

1537.title: Relating to WV Secondary School Activities
1537.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission to promulgate legislative rules.West Virginia Code Â§18-2-25 was amended by two bills passed during the 2020 Regular Session of the Legislature, by the House. House Bill 4925 (passed last on March 4, 2020); House Bill 3127 (passed first on March 2, 2020). The two versions of this section have been merged into this bill. The addition of subsection designations and Subsection (e) were in one of the versions of this section and represent the only substantive differences between the two versions.

1538.title: Offering a tax credit to property owners who provide lease land to the state for access for bike trails and rafting/kayaking
1538.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an income tax credit in the amount of real property taxes paid on real property that is being leased for recreational purposes to the state or other subdivisions.

1539.title: Expiring funds to the Treasurer’s Office - American Rescue Plan Low-income Assistance Program
1539.description: The purpose of this bill is to make a supplemental appropriation of federal funds to the State Treasurer to be distributed to local governmental units for the purposes of assisting low-income residents for purposes advanced by and enumerated within the federally enacted American Rescue Plan.

1540.title: Providing for contracted employment of substitute teachers for 180 instructional days
1540.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the contracted employment substitute teachers for 180 instructional days at all schools with more than 200 students..

1541.title: Increasing the number of personal leave days that county board of education employees may use
1541.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of personal leave days that county board of education employees may use without regard to the cause for the absence from four to five.

1542.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
1542.title: Relating to teacher duty-free lunch and daily planning periods
1542.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for uniform procedures, agreement forms and benefits to ensure a teacher's exchange of his or her duty-free lunch to perform duties at the school is a voluntary exchange..

1543.title: Relating to classroom teachers and special education classroom teachers individualized education program requirements
1543.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit regular classroom teachers and special education classroom teachers who are required to participate an individualized education program committee from also being required to prepare or reduce to writing the individualized education program plan unless no other professional educator with the knowledge is available.

1544.title: Relating to state political party committees
1544.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that state executive committee create rules for state, district, and county executive committees; to remove ability of courts to review political party rules; to provide that political parties may select delegates to the national convention consistent with the national rules of their political party; to provide that presidential electors be chosen by state convention or state executive committee; and to remove limitation on contributions or expenditures over $1 million for state or county executive committee headquarters.

1545.title: Provide for criminal history record restrictions for certain persons
1545.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure for restricting access to criminal history record information of individuals who have been convicted of a crime and pardoned by the Governor.

1546.title: Relating to per diem jail costs
1546.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism for per diem cost sharing between counties and municipalities.

1547.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Department of Health and Human Resources
1547.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1548.last_action: Postponed indefinitely on 3rd reading, Special Calendar
1548.title: Relating to prohibiting a municipality or the governing body of any municipality from limiting rental of a property
1548.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit a municipality or the governing body of any municipality from limiting rental of a property in whole or in part other than uniform property regulation, zoning or the imposition of hotel occupancy tax, and to allow damages for violations by municipalities of this prohibition.

1549.title: Relating to student purchase and refunds of course material
1549.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit an institution from assessing a new or increased charge for required course materials to a student unless the institution allows the student to opt of the way the institution permits for the student to obtain the course materials and receive a refund for course materials already purchased.

1550.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
1550.title: Uniform Recognition and Enforcement of Canadian Domestic Violence Protective Orders Act
1550.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a framework by which Canadian domestic violence orders can be recognized, registered, enforced by law enforcement, and enforced by the courts of West Virginia.

1551.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Veterans' Assistance
1551.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

1552.title: Relating to providing an exception to the provisions of the Uniform Common Interest Ownership Act (UCOIA)
1552.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that planned communities may choose to be subject to the UCIOA.

1553.title: Relating to defining a newborn safety device
1553.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the installation of newborn safety devices at a hospital, medical facility or participating fire department.

1554.title: Relating to expanding the definitions of land and recreational purposes
1554.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the definition of "land" and "recreational purposes" to include rock climbing and bouldering activities for purposes of limiting liability of landowners.

1555.title: Relating generally to creating the Joint Legislative Committee on Civic Life
1555.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the function of the Institute for Civic Life for promotion of cultural values for Civic life in local communities and the oversight thereof.

1556.title: Relating to the West Virginia Fusion Center
1556.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the makeup of the Fusion Center Oversight Committee and to provide reporting requirements pertaining to Fusion Center operations as well as any violations of the safeguards provided in this bill.

1558.description: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Human Services - Energy Assistance

1654.description: Requesting a study to assess whether the code contains outdated excessive or unecessary provisions.

1655.title: Requesting a study concerning the construction of welcome centers.
1655.description: Requesting a study concerning the construction of welcome centers.

1656.title: Requesting a study of creating regional intra-state tourism districts
1656.description: Requesting a study of creating regional intra-state tourism districts

1657.title: Requesting a study concerning tourism related infrastructure issues post covid-19.
1657.description: Requesting a study concerning tourism related infrastructure issues post covid-19.

1658.title: Proclaiming the extension of a state of emergency in our correctional institutions
1658.description: Proclaiming the extension of a state of emergency in our correctional institutions

1659.title: Requesting the Department of Economic Development to create a plan of incentives to encourage small businesses based in agri-tourism, craft breweries, distilleries, vineyards, wineries and other specialized agriculture of tourism interest to locate or relocate to West Virginia
1659.description: Requesting the Department of Economic Development to create a plan of incentives to encourage small businesses based in agri-tourism, craft breweries, distilleries, vineyards, wineries and other specialized agriculture of tourism interest to locate or relocate to West Virginia

1660.title: To study pediatric cancer in Appalachia and to provide directive language asking for a report on this issue in the appalachian region.
1660.description: To study pediatric cancer in Appalachia and to provide directive language asking for a report on this issue in the appalachian region.

1661.title: Requesting Joint Committee on Government and Finance study on the problem of tire disposal and finding solutions to rid our landscape of waste tires.
1661.description: Requesting Joint Committee on Government and Finance study on the problem of tire disposal and finding solutions to rid our landscape of waste tires.

1662.title: February to be designated annually as West Virginia Cancer Prevention Month.
1662.description: February to be designated annually as West Virginia Cancer Prevention Month.

1663.title: Joint Committee on Government and Finance study concerning debt collection practices by non-profit hospitals and/or health clinics who are funded in whole or in part by state funding appropriation in WV and assess the propriety of debt collection practices
1663.description: Joint Committee on Government and Finance study concerning debt collection practices by non-profit hospitals and/or health clinics who are funded in whole or in part by state funding appropriation in WV and assess the propriety of debt collection practices

1664.title: Requesting the Joint Committee on Government and Finance study state aid for students of veterinary medicine
1664.description: Requesting the Joint Committee on Government and Finance study state aid for students of veterinary medicine

1665.title: Requesting study to assess the need for and best practices by which to achieve legislative oversight of the West Virginia Fusion Center
1665.description: Requesting study to assess the need for and best practices by which to achieve legislative oversight of the West Virginia Fusion Center

1666.title: Study grant of continuing legal education credit to members of WV State Bar who serve in legislature and serve that body as per diem attorneys.
1666.description: Study grant of continuing legal education credit to members of WV State Bar who serve in legislature and serve that body as per diem attorneys.

1667.title: Guaranteeing the right of the citizens of West Virginia to hunt and fish
1667.description: The purpose of this resolution is to guarantee the right of the citizens of West Virginia to hunt and fish. The resolution provides that the Legislature and Division of Natural Resources pass and adopt statutes and regulations to promote wildlife conservation. The resolution provides that it does not erode laws concerning trespass or property rights.

1668.title: Lower the age to run for a State Senator to 21
1668.description: The purpose of this resolution is to lower the eligibility age of Senators from 25 years old to 21 years old.

1669.title: Taxpayers Bill of Rights
1669.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to Â§51, Article VI of the Constitution to establish a general fund expenditure limit. The amendment is designated "Taxpayer Bill of Rights."

1670.title: Amend the state Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum and recall
1670.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the state Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum, and recall. The resolution sets forth its scope, limitations, and exceptions.

1671.title: Allowing an elected state official to be a government employee or employee of a public school, college, or university
1671.description: The purpose of this resolution is to allow an elected state official to be a government employee or employee of a public school, college, or university.

1672.title: Increasing the Homestead Exemption
1672.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase the homestead exemption $20,000 every five years of age, until at age 80 when the maximum exemption is $80,000.

1673.title: Increase Homestead exemption
1673.description: The purpose of this resolution is to permit the homestead tax exemption to be increased in $20,000 increments every five years for persons with annual income that does not exceed $20,000, for a maximum exemption of $100,000 at age 85.

1674.title: Disabled Veteran’s Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1674.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the state Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who have been determined to have a 100 percent or more disability from ad valorem property taxation on the assessed value of his or her primary residence plus all personal property.

1675.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1675.title: Natural Resources and the Public Estate Amendment
1675.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide the people with the right to clean air, pure water, and maintenance of our State's natural resources for current and future generations.

1676.title: Senior Citizen Homestead Valuation Amendment
1676.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a constitutional amendment that would lock the value of a homestead property owned by a citizen of 65 years of age or older, for the purpose of calculating property taxes, at the assessed value when the owner-occupier turned 65 or purchased the property, whichever occurred later.

1677.title: Initiative, Referendum and Recall
1677.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum and recall. The resolution sets forth its scope, limitations and exceptions.

1678.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1678.title: Amending the Constitution to provide for the right to food, food sovereignty and freedom from hunger
1678.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the constitution to include as a right under the state Bill of Rights that all people have a natural, inherent and unalienable right to food and have a fundamental right to be free from hunger, malnutrition, starvation and the endangerment of life from the scarcity of or lack of access to nourishing food.

1679.title: Repealing the business and inventory ad valorem tangible personal property tax.
1679.description: The purpose of this resolution is to permit the Legislature to repeal the business and inventory ad valorem tangible personal property tax and to require the Legislature create a mechanism to replace funding that counties receive from the business and inventory ad valorem tangible personal property tax.

1680.title: Amending the Homestead Exemption of the Constitution
1680.description: The purpose of this resolution is to change the language relating to the amount of the Homestead Exemption from "the first $20,000" to "not less than the first $20,000" of the Homestead Exemption.

1681.title: Super-Majority Required for Passage of Tax Bill Amendment
1681.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution to require that bills imposing a tax or license fee and bills increasing the effective rate of any tax levied or fee imposed may not be enacted unless two thirds of the members of each house, present and voting, vote in the affirmative for passage.

1682.title: Manufacturing inventory and equipment tax exemption amendment
1682.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution that would exempt personal property in the form of manufacturing inventory and manufacturing equipment from ad valorem taxation.

1683.title: Providing for the election of members of the State Board of Education
1683.description: The purpose of this amendment is to provide for the election of six members of the West Virginia Board of Education, every six years, in a manner provided by law.

1684.title: To established a tiered reduction on property taxes for disabled veterans.
1684.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the State Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who have been determined to have a 100 percent or more disability from ad valorem property taxation on the assessed value of his or her primary residence plus all personal property and then a tiered exemption based on a lesser percent of disability.

1685.title: Providing Term Limits for certain Constitutional Officers
1685.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the constitution to prevent any person from serving in the office of Secretary of State, Auditor, Treasurer, Commissioner of Agriculture, or Attorney General for more than three consecutive terms beginning after January 1, 2025.

1686.title: Right to Farm and Ranch Amendment
1686.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the Constitution to guarantee the right of farmers and ranchers to engage in natural, traditional, or modern farming or ranching practices in the state.

1687.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1687.title: Amending Constitution to allow for possession, manufacture and sale of cannabis
1687.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would legalize cannabis possession; allow for the manufacture and sale of cannabis to be authorized by the Legislature; and allow the expungement and dismissal of convictions thereto.

1688.title: To allow certain state employees the eligibility to a seat in the legislature
1688.description: The purpose of this resolution is to reestablish eligibility requirements for officers and employees of the state and certain political subdivisions thereof to serve in the Legislature.

1689.title: Relating to the prohibition of unreasonable searches and seizures.
1689.description: The purpose of this resolution is to protect the personal, real, tangible, or digital property personally possessed or possessed by another from unreasonable search and seizure.

1690.title: Lowering the threshold required for a fire levy
1690.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to lower the threshold required for the passage of a fire levy.

1691.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1691.title: Relating to the right to refuse any medical treatment, injection, device, vaccine or prophylactic
1691.description: The purpose of this resolution is to add a new section to Article III of the West Virginia Constitution, to recognize the right to refuse medical treatments, injections, devices, vaccines, or prophylactics and to further provide equal protection under the law and the right to public accommodation for persons that exercise this right.

1692.title: Legislature Assembly Amendment
1692.description: The purpose of this resolution is to enable the Legislature to be more responsive to the constituent's needs and work closer with the Executive Branch through out the year rather than the once-a-year session.Strikethroughs indicate language that would be stricken from a heading or the present law and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

1693.title: To give a personal tax break of 50% to disabled veterans and 50% off hunting or fishing licenses.
1693.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for an election to amend the State Constitution to exempt honorably discharged veterans of the Armed Forces of the United States who have been determined to have a 100 percent or more disability from ad valorem property taxation on the assessed value of his or her primary residence plus all personal property and then a tiered exemption based on a lesser percent of disability and to require that honorably discharged veterans will only be charged half the cost of a hunting or fishing license.

1694.title: Relating to preventing any individual from serving in the office of Secretary of State, Auditor, State Treasurer, Commissioner of Agriculture, or Attorney General for more than three consecutive terms
1694.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the constitution to prevent any person from serving in the office of Secretary of State, Auditor, Treasurer, Commissioner of Agriculture, or Attorney General for more than three consecutive terms beginning after January 1, 2025.

1695.description: Requiring Higher Education Policy Commission to create and administer PROMISE Plus Program
