2303.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the approval of decommissioning or deconstructing of an existing power plant.

2304.title: Affordable Medicaid Buy-in Program
2304.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Affordable Medicaid Buy-In Program. The bill requires the Department of Health and Human Resources to develop and administer the Affordable Medicaid Buy-In Plan. The bill creates the Health Care Affordability and Access Improvement Fund. The bill establishes an advisory council to the Affordable Medicaid Buy-In Program. The bill requires a study and reposts be made. The bill defines terms. The bill sets limitations of employers. The bill requires rulemaking.

2305.title: Applying penalties for nonpayment of royalties under terms of oil and natural gas leases
2305.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for enhanced damages for nonpayment of royalties due from oil, natural gas, or natural gas liquids production under the terms of a lease or other agreement.

2306.title: Eliminating certain centers from certificate of need review
2306.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate birthing centers, ambulatory surgery centers, and ambulatory care centers, from certificate of need review. The bill eliminates birthing centers from exemptions; creates a three-year pilot program for MRI and CT; and directs the board to make a recommendation regarding the pilot program. In the absence of a recommendation, the pilot program will become permanent.

2307.title: Relating generally to certificates of need
2307.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt hospitals providing defined hospital services from certificate of need requirements.

2308.title: Extending jurisdiction of School Safety Unit
2308.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the language in the statutes relating to modifying the language in the statutes to extend the jurisdiction of the School Safety Unit of the Division of Protective Services, Capitol Police, to provide services to schools, such as primary, secondary, and post-secondary schools, whether public or private, for purposes of conducting inspections and making recommendations on matters of school safety and compliance throughout the state; and, to extend the jurisdiction of the officers assigned to the School Safety Unit of the Division of Protective Services, Capitol Police, to have statewide jurisdiction in order to respond to and investigate matters of school safety.

2309.title: Prohibiting mandates for vaccines
2309.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit mandates for vaccinations.

2310.title: WV Veterans' Home Loan Mortgage Program of 2023
2310.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Veterans' Home Loan Mortgage Program of 2023

2311.title: Relating to Intellectual and Development Disabilities Waiver Program Workforce Study
2311.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of the Bureau for Medical Services to produce a report to determine the recommended levels of reimbursement for home and community-based providers that service Intellectual/Developmental Disability (I/DD) patients.

2312.title: Providing that fairness in cost sharing calculation does not apply to voluntary Cost Share Assistance Program
2312.description: The purpose of this bill is to define a voluntary cost share assistance program and provide that this law not to apply to amounts obtained under this program.

2313.title: Allowing teachers in public schools to teach intelligent design
2313.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow teachers in public schools, including public charter schools, that include any one or more of grades Kindergarten through 12 to teach intelligent design as a theory of how the universe and/or humanity came to exist.

2314.title: Increasing maximum number of registered voters per precinct and distance between polling places
2314.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the distance between existing polling places that may be considered for consolidation into a single precinct, and increasing the maximum allowed number or registered voters per precinct.

2315.title: Requiring sheriff to serve child abuse and neglect petitions
2315.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the sheriff serve child abuse and neglect petitions without additional compensation.

2316.title: Including state correctional officers in DNR Police Officer Retirement System
2316.description: The purpose of this bill is to include state correctional officers in the Division of Natural Resources Police Officer Retirement System.

2317.title: Authorizing firefighters employed by WV National Guard to be members of Emergency Medical Services Retirement System
2317.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize firefighters employed by the 130th and 167th Airlift Wings of the West Virginia National Guard to be members of the Emergency Medical Services Retirement System.

2318.title: Clarifying offense of vehicular homicide
2318.description: The purpose of this bill is to further define the offense of vehicular homicide. The bill changes negligent homicide to vehicular homicide. The bill adds a misdemeanor offense for when a person dies within a year as a proximate result of driving in a negligent manner.

2319.title: Requiring certain transcripts to be accepted as record of student's performance for placement in micro school programs
2319.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certain transcripts or credentials to be accepted as record of students previous performance for placement and credit assignment for microschool programs.

2320.title: Increasing penalties for operating house of prostitution
2320.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for operating a house of prostitution from a misdemeanor to a felony in order to provide law enforcement with adequate tools to address human trafficking in the illegal sex trade industries.

2321.title: Establishing solar program for subscribers to gain credits against their utility bills
2321.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a community solar program where subscribers can purchase an interest in a solar facility and use credits against their electric utility costs; establishing parameters and conditions for the program; and provided for administration and rulemaking by the Public Service Commission.

2322.title: Revising provisions related to public charter schools
2322.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify provisions related to public charter schools in response to issues during the initial implementation and to clarify their access to other sources of public school funding. The funding issues include eligibility for funding from the School Safety Fund and codifying a requirement for a State Board rule on providing increased enrollment funding for public charter schools. The bill provides for invoicing to ensure that certain funding follows the student when students transfer to and from noncharter and charter public schools after the beginning of the school year. It also authorizes the Professional Charter School Board to receive and expend gifts, grants, and donations to carry out purposes of act, to apply for federal funds to implement programs, and to make start-up grants to public charter schools.

2323.title: Establishing auto-renewal program for wildlife licenses
2323.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish an auto-renewal licensing program that is eligible for discounts on licensing fees.

2324.title: Creating offense of knowingly and willfully obstructing social service worker
2324.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the criminal offense of knowingly and willfully obstructing a social service worker, a person acting in his or her official capacity.

2325.title: Updating administration, funding, and requirements for federal elections held in WV
2325.description: The purpose of this bill is to expend federal appropriations from Congress to the Secretary of State for purposes that further the administration of federal elections held in the state, payable from the County Assistance Voting Equipment Fund; clarify the uniform statewide deadline for electronically submitted voter registration applications and change the deadline by which county clerks must report voter participation history after an election into the statewide voter registration system from 120 days to 80 days after an election; make procedures for election contests before a special court applicable to contested elections of certain judges; changing jurisdiction of election contests for county, district, and municipal elections to the circuit courts; requiring a recount proceeding to be completed before filing certain election contests; and clarify the amendments made to Â§3-10-3 by HB 4785 (2022), which changed the timeframe in subsection (d) for filling vacancies in all judicial offices from two to three years.

2326.title: Prohibiting mandatory COVID-19 or other experimental vaccines for school attendance
2326.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the COVID-19 or other experimental vaccines for school attendance. Parents or guardians have a right to object to vaccinations based upon reasons of conscience, including religious and philosophical reasons.

2327.title: Requiring prompt appearances for persons detained on capiases
2327.description: The purpose of this bill relates to the failure to appear. It requires prompt appearances for persons detained on capiases; provides procedures for issuing bench warrants for nonappearance at scheduled court hearings; allows a grace period after a failure to appear to allow a defendant to appear; provides procedures following execution of bench warrants for nonappearance; and requires courts to ensure that inactive capiases are removed from law enforcement databases.

2328.title: Increasing value at which municipal property must be sold through public auction
2328.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the value at which municipal property must be sold through public auction and allowing for the negotiated sale of real property to adjacent property owners.

2329.title: Updating language and increasing penalties for indecent exposure
2329.description: The purpose of this bill is to change language concerning indecent exposure and increase the penalties associated with it.

2330.title: Authorizing transfers to and from Licensed Racetrack Modernization Fund
2330.description: The purpose of this bill relates to racetrack video lottery. The bill provides for certain transfers to and from the Licensed Racetrack Modernization Fund; specifies the eligible purpose for recoupment of funds on deposit in facility modernization account within the Licensed Racetrack Modernization Fund; and makes the Licensed Racetrack Modernization Fund permanent.

2331.title: Fair Access to Financial Services Act
2331.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "Fair Access to Financial Services Act". The bill provides for a short title. The bill provides for legislative findings. Finally, the bill provides for enactment of the article.Strikethroughs indicate language that would be stricken from a heading or the present law and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

2332.title: Providing bonuses to school personnel for unused personal days
2332.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide bonuses for unused days of personal leave for school personnel, including professional and service employees.

2333.title: Authorizing restitution to victims of securities fraud
2333.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize restitution to victims of securities fraud and to create a fund for that purpose.

2334.title: Requiring DOH develop formula for allocating road funds among districts
2334.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Highways to develop a formula for allocating road funds among districts, for the benefit of the counties; to make legislative findings; to require the commissioner to solicit and consider public comments; to require the commissioner to consider certain factors when developing the formula; and to require the commissioner to submit the formula to the Legislature for approval as a legislative rule.

2335.title: Clarifying when magistrate vacancies shall be filled
2335.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the amendments made to this section by HB 4785 (2022), which changed the timeframe in subsection (d) for filling vacancies in all judicial offices from two to three years.

2336.title: Changing deadline for county clerks to report voter participation history
2336.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the deadline by which county clerks must report voter participation history after an election into the statewide voter registration system from 120 days to 80 days after an election.

2337.title: Updating administration of federal elections held in WV
2337.description: The purpose of this bill is to expend federal appropriations from Congress to the Secretary of State for purposes that further the administration of federal elections held in the state, payable from the County Assistance Voting Equipment Fund.

2338.title: Updating contested elections procedures
2338.description: The purpose of this bill is to make procedures for election contests before a special court applicable to contested elections of certain judges; changing jurisdiction of election contests for county, district, and municipal elections to the circuit courts; requiring a recount proceeding to be completed before filing certain election contests.

2339.title: Prohibiting laws requiring person to receive or use medical products
2339.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that no law may require a person to receive or use a medical product and to ensure that there will be no penalties associated with refusing the medical product or refusing to disclose whether the product has been used or not.

2340.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
2340.title: Creating emeritus physician license
2340.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an emeritus physician license for retired physicians. The bill provides that when granted, a license is valid for life, unless revoked by the West Virginia Board of Medicine.

2341.title: Relating to substantiation of abuse and neglect allegations
2341.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the amounts of time a name will appear on the child abuse registry for various offenses.

2342.title: Amending deliberate intent exception to immunities provided under workers' compensation
2342.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the deliberate intent statute to limit noneconomic damages to $250,000, remove occupational pneumoconiosis from compensable injuries under deliberate intent, require bifurcation to enhance speedy resolution of non-meritorious claims, and to cap attorney's fees to the same amount allowable under the other portions of Chapter 23.

2343.title: Authorizing Berkeley County Council to change its name to Berkeley County Commission
2343.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Berkeley County Commission to change its name to the Berkeley County Commission.

2344.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
2344.title: Allowing physician assistants to own practice
2344.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow physician assistants to own a practice. This bill also allows the West Virginia Board of Medicine to deny a license or other authorization to physician assistants who make unlawful referrals where that physician assistant has a proprietary interest. It provides that the term "physician assistant" is synonymous with

2345.title: Oral Health and Cancer Rights Act
2345.description: The purpose of this bill relates to requiring health benefit plan coverage for medically necessary dental procedures that result from cancer treatment. The bill creates the Oral Health and Cancer Rights Act; explains the scope of procedures covered as a result of certain cancer treatments; requires the use of a specific billing identifier; and sets an effective date.

2346.title: Modifying Municipal Home Rule appeals
2346.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify Municipal Home Rule appeals. The bill provides for appeals and grounds therefor. The bill provides who is eligible to appeal. Finally, the bill provides procedures for the appeal.

2347.title: Allowing group of affiliated voters to become recognized political party
2347.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a group of affiliated voters to become a recognized political party if the 888group's candidate receives at least one percent of the votes statewide in an election for either President or Governor.

2348.title: Requiring cooperation with child support enforcement as condition for public assistance
2348.description: The purpose of this bill is to require cooperation with child support enforcement as a condition of eligibility for public assistance and authorize rulemaking.

2349.title: Parents' Bill of Rights
2349.description: The purpose of this bill is to codify a Parents' Bill of Rights.

2350.title: Verifying legal employment status of workers to governmental agencies
2350.description: The purpose of this bill is to verify the legal employment status of all persons who come into their employ and to report their employment to the appropriate governmental agencies. The bill defines "E-Verify", the electronic verification of federal employment authorization program of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996, and provides that unauthorized workers employment is prohibited.

2351.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
2351.title: WV Long-Term Care Insurance Act
2351.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for prohibitions regarding long term care insurance and provide for an effective date.

2352.title: Clarifying WV follow market-based approach to business and occupation taxation
2352.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that West Virginia follows a market-based approach to municipal business and occupation taxation, in line with rulings of the Supreme Court of the United States recognizing that the national economy has changed dramatically with the growth of the internet.

2353.title: Clarifying juvenile competency determination process extends to status offenders
2353.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the juvenile competency determination process extends to status offenders.

2354.title: Establishing aggravated felony offense of reckless driving resulting in death
2354.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the aggravated criminal offense of reckless driving resulting in death, establish the related penalty, and make several non-substantive technical corrections.

2355.title: Clarifying preferential recall rights for employees sustaining compensable injury
2355.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the preferential recall rights for employees sustaining a compensable injury.

2356.title: Expanding exemption for private practice physicians to provide MRIs
2356.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the exemption for private practice physicians to provide magnetic resonance imaging services without certificate of need review. The bill provides that to be eligible the private office practice must have at least five private office practice locations and 75 percent of the MRI service are for patients of the private office practice of the total MRI services performed.

2357.title: Approving overtime pay for teachers
2357.description: The purpose of this bill is to approve overtime pay for teachers, based on a 200 day contract and minimum salary schedule on an hourly rate.

2358.title: Dissolving PEIA and converting to employer-owned mutual insurance company
2358.description: The purpose of this bill is to dissolve the Public Employees Insurance Agency and convert it to an employer-owned mutual insurance company.

2359.title: Amending licensure requirements for massage therapist
2359.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the requirements for licensure as a massage therapist and establish a massage establishment license. Course work hours are amended to conform with the massage therapy interstate compact being considered nationally and in alignment with the course work required by WV Massage Therapy instructional programs. This bill further provides for the licensure of massage establishments.

2360.title: Placing cap on maximum penalty that may be imposed for first-degree robbery
2360.description: The purpose of this bill is to place a cap on the maximum penalty--50 years-- that can be imposed upon conviction for first-degree robbery.

2361.title: Requiring periodic performance audits of WV Secondary School Activities Commission
2361.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the legislative auditor conduct periodic performance audits of the West Virginia Secondary Schools Athletic Commission.

2362.title: Requiring patient notification when screening indicates dense breast tissue
2362.description: Requiring patient notification when screening indicates dense breast tissue

2363.title: Creating criminal offense prohibiting public disclosure of restricted information
2363.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit public disclosure of restricted information.

2364.title: Clarifying process for filling vacancies in Legislature
2364.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the responsibility of the Governor to fill a vacancy in the state legislature. The bill provides a process for the selection of three legally qualified persons to fill a vacancy in the office of state senator or House of Delegates, allows for virtual candidate interviews where more than three candidates apply, and clarifies the interview process. It also provides that a party county chairman appoint a subcommittee to act as vacancy committee where a senate or delegate district is wholly within one county.

2365.title: Modifying e-bike regulations
2365.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the laws on e-bikes in West Virginia to more closely comport to federal law.

2366.title: Requiring parity with non-preferred oral branded antipsychotic agents
2366.description: The purpose of this bill is to require parity with non-preferred oral branded antipsychotic agents by the Department of Health and Human Services and the Division of Medicaid.

2367.title: Providing voters with ability to identify and verify their ballot cast
2367.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide voters with the ability to identify and verify their ballot cast in a statewide election held in West Virginia.

2368.title: Providing statutory recognition and appointment of board members for WV First Foundation
2368.description: The purpose of this bill to provide statutory recognition of the creation of the West Virginia First Foundation pursuant to the terms of the West Virginia First Memorandum of Understanding and to authorize the appointment of board members to the West Virginia First Foundation by the Governor and Regional authorities.

2369.title: Increasing reimbursement of sexual assault forensic medical examination kits
2369.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase reimbursement levels for sexual assault forensic examination kits, provide a mechanism for the Legislature to monitor adequacy of reimbursement rates, and assess the health levels of the Sexual Assault Examination Fund that funds these reimbursements.

2370.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
2370.title: Requiring report on Medicaid fees and managed care provider reimbursements compared to PEIA, Medicare, and surrounding states
2370.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a report on Medicaid fees for service and managed care provider reimbursements compared to PEIA, Medicare and surrounding states.

2371.title: Clarifying role and responsibilities of State Resiliency Officer
2371.description: The purpose of this bill relates to the West Virginia Disaster Recovery Trust Fund and clarifies the roles and responsibilities of the State Resiliency Officer. The bill requires the State Resiliency Officer to submit a new Flood Resiliency Plan by a date certain and then biannually thereafter; directs the State Resiliency Officer to hire additional staff; removes the West Virginia Disaster Recovery Trust Fund from the jurisdiction of the Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Management; provides initial capital for the State Resiliency Office; allows for disbursement of post-disaster recovery assistance; requires that 50 percent of disbursements be expended to benefit low-income communities; requires resilience and mitigation certifications prior to disbursement to political subdivisions; requires the State Resiliency Officer to develop an annual expenditure report; establishes the West Virginia Resiliency Trust Fund within the State Resiliency and Flood Protection Act; requires 50 percent of disbursements be expended to implement nature-based solutions; allows for grants to political subdivisions for both Flood Resiliency Plan implementation and local flood prevention and protection studies; and requires 25 percent of Community Development Block Grant Disaster Recovery Funds received by the state as a result of a flood disaster to be deposited in the Flood Resiliency Trust Fund.

2372.title: Adding appropriations to DHHR, Division of Human Services
2372.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a new item of appropriation to the Department of Health and human Resources, Division of Human Services.

2373.title: Requiring Office of Inspector General to promulgate rules concerning location of forensic group homes
2373.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Office of Inspector General to promulgate rules concerning the location of forensic group homes.

2374.title: Modifying awards and benefits for WV State Police officers who take disability retirement
2374.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the awards and benefits to dependents of dependents of State Police officers who must take disability retirement to better match the awards and benefits of the dependents of State Police retirants who serve twenty years without disability retirement.

2375.title: Clarifying that juvenile competency determination process extends to status offenders
2375.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the juvenile competency determination process extends to status offenders.

2376.title: Requiring municipal elections to be held on same day as statewide elections
2376.description: The purpose of this bill is to require municipal elections to be held on statewide election days.

2377.title: Changing name of School Building Authority to School Maintenance Authority
2377.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the name of the School Building Authority to the School Maintenance Authority.

2378.title: Maintaining nursing board standards and accreditation
2378.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that quality indicators for evaluation of a nursing education program be defined, describe when program visits to a nursing pre-licensure program may be conducted, granting of conditional approval by the board, and actions if the school closes.

2379.title: Amending deliberate intent exception to immunities provided under workers compensation
2379.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the deliberate intent statute to limit noneconomic damages to $250,000, remove occupational pneumoconiosis from compensable injuries under deliberate intent, require bifurcation to enhance speedy resolution of non-meritorious claims, and to cap attorneys fees to the same amount allowable under the other portions of Chapter 23.

2381.title: Requiring law-enforcement agencies and CPS report certain allegations to county school personnel
2381.description: The purpose of this bill is to create obligations on law enforcement and CPS to notify certain school personnel of investigations regarding school employees involving certain conduct towards students.

2382.title: Allowing BOE to hire retired teachers to assist with tutoring
2382.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county boards of education to contract with retired teachers to provide tutoring services in reading and math to support the need of one-on-one intervention for students; stating purpose; authorizing county to enter a contract with retired teacher; defining terms; providing tutor eligibility requirements; providing exclusions from eligibility; liability; and providing miscellaneous provisions regarding program.

2383.title: Establishing resident and nonresident wildlife viewing stamps
2383.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a wildlife viewing program through an additional stamp or endorsement upon a state-issued hunting or fishing license.

2384.title: Allocating funds to WV Motorsports Committee
2384.description: The purpose of this bill to provide a onetime allocation of $100,000 to the West Virginia Motorsports Committee by the Economic development promotion and closing fund to be used solely for travel expenses and promotion of West Virginia motorsports, subject to availability of funds.

2385.title: Requiring Mountaineer Challenge Academy and Bureau for Social Services to provide reimbursement for cadets' enrollment costs
2385.description: The purpose of this bill is to use Department of Health and Human Resources group home funds to assist cadets enrollment at the Mountaineer Challenge Academy.

2386.title: Relating to gender reassignment medical services for minors
2386.description: The purpose of this bill is relating to gender reassignment medical services for minors; making findings and declarations; defining sex; establishing prohibited treatment for minors; providing exceptions; creating responsibilities for school personnel; and establishing consequences for violations of article

2387.title: Permitting Mountaineer ChalleNGe Academy cadets to enroll in accredited courses to obtain WV Education Information System Number
2387.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit cadets the Mountaineer Challenge Academy; to enroll in accredited virtual instructional courses online or to attend accredited courses, in person, in order to obtain a West Virginia Education Information System Number (WVEIS#), from the state board of education.

2388.title: Providing supplemental Medicaid reimbursement for academic medical center acute care providers
2388.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for Supplemental Medicaid Reimbursement for Academic Medical Center Acute Care Providers.

2389.title: Increasing penalties for sexual assault against minors
2389.description: The purpose of this bill is to offer the option to receive an orchiectomy and to change the penalty to life imprisonment for crimes committed under Â§61-8B-3(a)(2), Â§61-8B-3(c), or Â§61-8B-5(a)(2) of this code.

2390.title: Prohibiting unlawful discriminatory practices covered by Human Rights Act and Fair Housing Act
2390.description: The purpose of this bill is to add "sexual orientation" and "gender identity" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodation. The bill adds "age", "sexual orientation" and "gender identity" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing. The bill defines "sexual orientation" and "gender identity".

2391.title: Prohibiting gender transition surgeries, treatments, and therapies to minors
2391.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit gender transition surgeries, treatments, and therapies to minors. The bill establishes penalties for practitioners in violation of regulations. The bill safeguards the mental and physical health of minors. The bill prohibits political subdivisions from enacting conflicting policies. The bill creates whistleblower protection. Finally, the bill prohibits taxpayer subsidization of gender transition treatments.

2392.title: Updating term of "physician assistant" to "physician associate"
2392.description: The purpose of this bill is to change code references to "physician assistant" to "physician associate." It defines physician associate to be synonymous with any other term that the American Academy of Physician Associates designates as the proper name of the profession formerly known as physician assistant. The bill also corrects one definition of physician associate by establishing that the physician associate is required to have a collaborative relationship with a physician, as opposed to the physician supervising the physician associate, which conforms with the rest of the code.

2393.title: Allocating funds to WV Flatwater Trails Commission
2393.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a onetime allocation of $100,000 to the Flatwater Trail Commission by the Economic development promotion and closing fund to be used solely for travel expenses and promotion of flat water trails in West Virginia, subject to availability of funds.

2394.title: Transferring Division of Personnel duties to individual agencies
2394.description: The purpose of this bill is to cease operations of the Division of Personnel; provide for transfer of functions to individual agencies; and provide for rulemaking.

2395.title: Updating administration and requirements of Managed Timberland Program
2395.description: The purpose of this bill relates to the administration of the managed timberland program; authorizing county assessors to require property owners produce carbon capture or carbon offset agreements related to the property; creating obligations of the Tax Commissioner related to the administration of the Managed Timberland Program; providing the Division of Forestry with rulemaking authority; requiring the Division of Forestry to develop internal policies and procedures for their role in the Managed Timberland Program; providing that the Division of Forestry and the State Tax Department shall work together to update the current Legislative Rule to minimize weaknesses in the processes and procedures of the Division of Forestry and the Tax Division regarding the operations of the Managed Timberland Program; and requiring county assessors to report the carbon capture and carbon offset agreements in their respective counties to the Tax Department annually.

2396.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Division of Natural Resources, Wildlife Resources
2396.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2397.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Transportation, DMV
2397.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2398.title: Making supplementary appropriation to BOE, Vocational Division
2398.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2399.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Division of Health, Maternal and Child Health
2399.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2400.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Agriculture, WV Spay Neuter Assistance Fund
2400.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2401.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, Economic Development Authority
2401.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2402.title: Making supplementary appropriation to BOE, School Lunch Program
2402.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2403.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, Consumer Advocate Fund
2403.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2404.title: Establishing Welcome Home Grant Program
2404.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Welcome Home Grant Program, a pilot program to incentivize veterans to relocate to West Virginia to reside and to work.

2405.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DOT, Division of Highways
2405.description: The purpose of supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2406.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Administration, Office of Technology
2406.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2407.title: Increasing number of districts and limit on approved costs under BUILD WV Act
2407.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of districts and the limit on approved costs under the BUILD WV Act.

2408.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DHS, Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority
2408.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, decrease and add new items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2409.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DHHR, WV Birth-to-Three Fund
2409.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2410.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Veterans’ Assistance, Veterans' Facilities Support Fund
2410.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2411.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DHHR, WV Safe Drinking Water Treatment
2411.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health -- West Virginia Safe Drinking Water Treatment, fund 8824, for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2412.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Division of Human Services, Child Care Development
2412.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation to the Division of Human Services -- Child Care and Development, fund 8817 account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2413.title: Making supplementary appropriation to BOE, School Building Authority
2413.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2414.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Miscellaneous Boards and Commissions, PSC
2414.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2415.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DHHR, Hospital Service Revenue Account
2415.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2416.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Commerce, Division of Rehabilitation Services
2416.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2417.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Agriculture
2417.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase an existing item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2418.title: Making supplementary appropriation to DHHR, Division of Human Services
2418.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2419.title: Requiring runoff elections for judicial candidates
2419.description: The purpose of this bill is to require judicial runoff elections if the candidate with the highest number of votes in the primary election does not receive a majority of the total votes cast, and to indicate on each nonpartisan judicial ballot each candidate's political party affiliation for information purposes.

2420.title: Preventing compensatory damage awards for outstanding medical expenses
2420.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent compensatory damage awards for medical expenses from including sums that the claimant has not and will not pay for medical care or treatment.

2421.title: Providing reports to DMV on mental and physical disabilities for driver's license
2421.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide reports on mental or physical disabilities, or disorders, to the Division of Motor Vehicles to determine an individual's medical competency to retain their driver's license. The bill also provides that this section shall be known as "McKayla, Miranda and Philip's Law".

2422.title: Clarifying department responsible for administration of certain programs
2422.description: The purpose of this bill is to properly reflect the Department responsible for the administration of respective programs.

2423.title: Establishing Energy Intensive Industrial or Manufacturing Consumer Tax Credit
2423.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Energy Intensive Industrial or Manufacturing Consumer Tax Credit.

2424.title: Expanding authority of Legislative Oversight Commission on Health and Human Resources Accountability
2424.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the authority of the Legislative Oversight Commission on Health and Human Resources Accountability Commission, to give authority for routine, and as needed reports and to describe how these reports are to be submitted.

2425.title: Requiring adjustment of verdicts for past expenses to reflect amount incurred and paid
2425.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the trier of fact to determine the actual amount of the prevailing party's pecuniary loss and to have judgment awards in tort actions be reduced by the amount of certain collateral source payments or benefits received by the plaintiff or to which the plaintiff is entitled, provided that such collateral source payments are for the same damages for which recovery is sought in the action.

2426.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
2426.title: Prohibiting insurer from imposing copayment for certain services
2426.description: Prohibiting insurer from imposing copayment for certain services

2427.title: Relating to wildlife licenses and stamps
2427.description: Relating to wildlife licenses and stamps

2428.title: Requiring adoption of cloud computing services by state agencies
2428.description: Requiring adoption of cloud computing services by state agencies

2430.title: Establishing three-year nontraditional school week pilot project
2430.description: Establishing three-year nontraditional school week pilot project

2433.title: Relating to moratorium on carbon capture agreements
2433.description: Relating to moratorium on carbon capture agreements

2434.title: Relating to compensation and expense reimbursement for members of Legislature
2434.description: Relating to compensation and expense reimbursement for members of Legislature

2435.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Department of Commerce, Division of Forestry
2435.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend and add new items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2438.title: Making supplemental appropriation to Department of Economic Development, Office of Secretary
2438.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation from the State Fund, General Revenue unappropriated surplus for the fiscal year 2023.

2439.title: Making supplemental appropriation to Executive, Governor's Office, Coronavirus State Fiscal Recovery Fund
2439.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to amend by decreasing and increasing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2440.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Adjutant General, State Militia
2440.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend and add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2441.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Governor's Office, Civil Contingent Fund
2441.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2442.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to DOT, Division of Multimodal Transportation Facilities, State Rail Authority
2442.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to amend and increase an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2443.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Department of Administration, Division of General Services
2443.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2444.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to BOE, State Department of Education, Classroom Aide Program
2444.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2445.title: Making a supplemental appropriation to Department of Revenue, State Budget Office
2445.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation from the State Fund, General Revenue unappropriated surplus for the fiscal year 2023.

2446.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Adjutant General, State Militia
2446.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to increase an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2447.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to Department of Commerce, Office of Secretary
2447.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2449.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to DOT, Division of Multimodal Transportation Facilities, Public Transit
2449.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to amend and increase an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2023.

2451.title: Supplementing and amending appropriation to DHS, Division of Corrections and Rehabilitations, Correctional Units

2531.title: Protection of Right to Bear Arms Amendment
2531.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to prohibit the state, counties, municipalities, or other political subdivisions of the state from restricting the right to keep and bear arms.

2532.title: Disabled Veterans' Exemption from Ad Valorem Property Taxation Amendment
2532.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the Constitution to authorize the Legislature to exempt veterans from payment of all or part of ad valorem taxes if the veteran has a service-related disability of 100 percent.

2533.title: Constitutional Officer Term Limit Amendment
2533.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the constitution to prevent any person from serving in the office of secretary of state, auditor, treasurer, commissioner of agriculture, or attorney general for more than three consecutive terms.

2535.title: County Boundary Review Amendment
2535.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a Constitutional Amendment to allow the Legislature to redraw county boundaries and combine counties every 100 years.

2536.title: Homestead Exemption for Disabled Veterans Amendment
2536.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would provide for a Homestead Exemption for Veterans with 100 percent service-connected disabilities.

2537.title: Fair County Commissioner Representation Amendment
2537.description: The purpose of this resolution is to permit the same West Virginia citizens in a magisterial district to be the sole electors of the county commissioners which represent those citizens.

2538.title: Fair School Board Representation Amendment
2538.description: The purpose of this resolution is to permit the same West Virginia citizens in a magisterial district to be the sole electors of the school board members which represent those citizens.

2539.title: Right to medical freedom amendment
2539.description: The purpose of this resolution is to ensure the right of a person to refuse any medical procedure, treatment, injection, device, vaccine, or prophylactic to not be questioned or interfered with in any manner.

2540.title: Returning Roads to Counties Amendment of 2023
2540.description: The purpose of this resolution is to return control of roads in West Virginia to the counties from the state.
